meta.name: Ghosts of Onigawa Campaign Expansion
meta.description: While visiting a friend in the remote farming hamlet of Minakami Village, the investigators will uncover a wicked plot involving the recent disappearances of two young local girls...
meta.author: Myriad

cards.name: The Hidden Village
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the number of the current act.
[cultist]: –1. Reveal another token.
[tablet]: –2. If you fail, add a [curse] token to the chaos bag.
[elder_thing]: –3. If you fail, place one of your clues on your current location.

cards.name: The Hidden Village
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of the current agenda.
[cultist]: –2. Reveal another token.
[tablet]: –3. Add a [curse] token to the chaos bag.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail, place one of your clues on your current location.

cards.flavor: Though the slight chill nipping at your extremities urges you to tread carefully, you are certain you are alone here; the only sound that pierces the veil of eerie silence blanketing these woods is your own heartbeat.
cards.name: Into the Wild
Time Flies
cards.text:
This leisurely hike through the woods has proven considerably more taxing than had you expected. As you wipe some errant spittle from the corner of your mouth, you suddenly notice that your breath is visible, hanging in the air before you like an apparition for the briefest of moments before evaporating into nothingness. You're not just imagining things: the chill has grown considerably more bitter since you entered the forest. Your head begins to ache as you try to catch a glimpse of the sky through the canopy overhead. It was a beautiful morning with clear skies when you departed the village; just how long have you been in here....?
Shuffle the set-aside Fearsome Fog encounter set and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: Frankly, the foggy forest frequently feels far from friendly. From underfoot, the fetid fumes of fallow, festering fecundity fuel a frantic fight-or-flight frenzy, and further forth from your flank, the fluttering of foul flies frequenting the fragile, frozen-over flower fields fully forms a flickering flash of fickle fear. Forward feels foolhardy, but furtively fleeing for freedom feels futile...
cards.name: Foggy Fettles
Feeling Funny
cards.text:
Something strange is going on here; it's impossible to tell through the smothering fog that has rolled in, but it definitely feels darker now than when you entered. Has the sun gone down already? The dull ache in your temple has grown to a rhythmic pounding and you're finding that it has become difficult to think, much less speak, although the growing discomfort in the back of your throat has also become concerning. It feels like your tongue has swollen to twice its normal size...
Each investigator must discard all non-weakness cards from their hand or take 2 horror. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

cards.name: Silent Night
cards.text: Investigators may not commit cards to tests performed by other investigators.

cards.name: Not a Whisper
cards.text:
Gasping for air, you fall to your knees. You can feel it now---the phantom noose tightening around your neck---but your frantic attempts to claw at it prove fruitless. As the world goes black, the last thing you see is a crimson butterfly dancing around your temple, and its gentle glow illuminating the slithering form of a tall woman emerging from a nearby fog bank...
Each surviving investigator is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.

cards.flavor: The villagers mentioned Takeshi was buried somewhere in this forest, but neglected to elaborate further. Somehow, you feel like you'll know his final resting place when you see it...
cards.name: Funeral for a Friend
cards.text: Objective - Find Takeshi's burial site. When each surviving investigator has paid their respects to Takeshi, advance.

cards.name: Rest in Peace
cards.text:
You spend a moment in silent contemplation as you examine the pauper's grave they left your friend to rot in. You suppose you ought to be grateful they bothered to drag him in here at all, but the distance between his grave markers and the others just doesn't sit right with you; it feels like a intentional slight. Perhaps there is more to Takeshi's death than you have been led to believe. Just as you resolve to return to the village and demand some answers, a mysterious light emerges from behind the cairn...
Put the set-aside The Crimson Butterfly (Lighting the Way) enemy into play at The Lonely Cairn. Remove the Forest Threshold location from the game and discard any cards attached to it. Move any enemies or investigators at that location to Grotto of the Guardians. Put the two set aside Secret Shrine locations into play, unrevealed.

cards.flavor: You find yourself entranced by the mysterious creature that has emerged from Takeshi's grave. its softly fluttering wings emit a warm glow as it hypnotically dances around you, but when you reach out for it, it recoils from your touch. Is it afraid of you? Or leading you somewhere...?
cards.name: Requiem
cards.text: Objective - Chase the butterfly. When the investigators have both the blessings of the sun and moon, advance.

cards.name: Night and Day
cards.text:
Thanks to the creature's guidance, you were able to uncover a pair of shrines hidden deep within the forest. There's a strange and ominous symmetry between them, but you are unable to grok what, if any, significance they may have. As you move to depart the second shrine, you notice a wisp of light descending through the canopy above and alighting upon the old torii gate you passed earlier. Suddenly, the mote of light vanishes, and the ground below you begins to shudder violently, throwing you into the dirt. Once the tremor passes and you manage to pick yourself up off the ground, an unholy shriek echoes from somewhere within the forest. The Crimson Butterfly begins to sway back and forth in the air, nervously...
Flip the Torii Gate (Forlorn, Forgotten) location to its reverse side. Put the set-aside Vengeful Echo enemy into play.

cards.flavor: Something has come alive in the forest, and The Crimson Butterfly is clearly unsettled by it. Unfortunately, the forest feels like it has "rearranged" itself while you've been inside it, somehow obscuring the exit. You strongly feel you should find your way back to the gate...before what ever is out there finds you.
cards.name: Between Angels and Insects
cards.text: Objective - If The Crimson Butterfly is at the Torii Gate location, advance.

cards.name: The Hidden Village
cards.text: The Crimson Butterfly vanishes from sight as it passes through the gateway and a yawning portal opens between its archways, casting the forest in a pale red light. On the other side of the crimson aperture, a rustic village beckons... (→R1)

cards.flavor:
You can't help but be slightly unnerved 
by the forest's deafening silence.
cards.name: Forest Threshold
cards.text: [action] If it is Act 3a: Resign. You head back to the village.

cards.flavor:
A modest stone archway bids you welcome 
to this tranquil sanctuary.
cards.name: Forest Threshold

cards.flavor:
Several of the shrines have fallen into disrepair, 
but you can still make out the distinct shapes 
of the animal spirits they once honored.
cards.name: Grotto of the Guardians
cards.text: [free]: Say a prayer. Ready an [[Aspect]] asset you control. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
A brook empties into a small reflecting pool, 
surrounded by a collection of shrines.
cards.name: Grotto of the Guardians

cards.flavor: These traditional archways are constructed to demarcate the transition from the secular to the sacred.
cards.name: Torii Gate
cards.text: Enemies may not enter Torii Gate and investigators may not enter Torii Gate if an enemy is in their threat area.

cards.flavor:
The red paint on the gate is peeling. 
Something is happening here...
cards.name: Torii Gate
cards.text: [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group: Move The Crimson Butterfly 1 location towards Torii Gate.

cards.flavor: You're gonna walk down to...
cards.name: Bamboo Avenue
cards.text: Investigators must spend an additional action to move away from Bamboo Avenue. [action] Exhaust a [[Melee]] asset you control: Test your weapon against the bamboo. Heal 2 horror. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
A solemn expanse of tall trees, shrubbery, 
and stonework beckons you deeper into the woods.
cards.name: Verdant Copse

cards.flavor:
There's no obvious need for the trail to twist this circuitously, but an abundance of caution keeps you 
from straying too far from the beaten path.
cards.name: Winding Wend
cards.text: Forced - After you move to Winding Wend: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, lose all remaining actions and end your turn.

cards.flavor:
A solemn expanse of tall trees, shrubbery, 
and stonework beckons you deeper into the woods.
cards.name: Verdant Copse

cards.flavor:
The numerous bundles of rice littering 
the secluded glen have been intentionally left to honor 
the patron saint of fertility and agriculture.
cards.name: Midori's Rise
cards.text: [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group: Choose a random set aside Untended Graves location and put it into play unrevealed. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
A solemn expanse of tall trees, shrubbery, 
and stonework beckons you deeper into the woods.
cards.name: Verdant Copse

cards.flavor:
The fable of the good-natured frog spirit 
and the treacherous scorpion who stung him is 
a favorite among the children of Minakami.
cards.name: Jiraiya's Redoubt
cards.text: [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group: Choose a random set aside Untended Graves location and put it into play unrevealed. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
A solemn expanse of tall trees, shrubbery, 
and stonework beckons you deeper into the woods.
cards.name: Verdant Copse

cards.flavor:
Long ago, cherry blossom petals blanketed 
the streets of Minakami. Now, this proud tree 
is the sole survivor of its kind.
cards.name: The Last Scion
cards.text: [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group: Choose a random set aside Untended Graves location and put it into play unrevealed. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
A solemn expanse of tall trees, shrubbery, 
and stonework beckons you deeper into the woods.
cards.name: Verdant Copse

cards.flavor: The size of the marker indicates the importance of the person it honors; this couldn't possibly be your friend.
cards.name: Hero's Surrender
cards.text: Hero's Surrender is connected to the [[Woods]] location that put it into play (and vice versa.) Forced - When Hero's Surrender is revealed: Draw the top card of the encounter deck.

cards.flavor:
A crowded collection of weathered 
stone markers catches your eye.
cards.name: Untended Graves
cards.text: Untended Graves is connected to the [[Woods]] location that put it into play (and vice versa.)

cards.flavor: Somehow, you know he's here...
cards.name: The Lonely Cairn
cards.text: The Lonely Cairn is connected to the [[Woods]] location that put it into play (and vice versa.) [action]: Remember that you have paid your respects to Takeshi. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
A crowded collection of weathered 
stone markers catches your eye.
cards.name: Untended Graves
cards.text: Untended Graves is connected to the Woods location that put it into play (and vice versa.)

cards.flavor:
This cluster of markers seems to represent a family; 
Takeshi never married, as far as you know.
cards.name: Widow's Respite
cards.text: Widow's Respite is connected to the [[Woods]] location that put it into play (and vice versa.) Forced - When Widow's Respite is revealed: Each investigator at Widow's Respite must discard a non-weakness card from their hand.

cards.flavor:
A crowded collection of weathered 
stone markers catches your eye.
cards.name: Untended Graves
cards.text: Untended Graves is connected to the [[Woods]] location that put it into play (and vice versa.)

cards.flavor:
A mysterious cloak of unnatural darkness 
smothers the grim altar.
cards.name: Shrine of the Moon
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues on Shrine of the Moon: Remember that you have the blessing of the moon. (Group limit one success per game.)

cards.flavor:
A mysterious effigy of a winged insect 
hangs over the blocked passageway...
cards.name: Secret Shrine
cards.text: The passage is sealed. Investigators may not enter Secret Shrine.

cards.flavor:
A dazzling shaft of blinding light 
envelops the modest altar.
cards.name: Shrine of the Sun
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues on Shrine of the Sun: Remember that you have the blessing of the sun. (Group limit one success per game.)

cards.flavor:
A mysterious effigy of a winged insect 
hangs over the blocked passageway...
cards.name: Secret Shrine
cards.text: The passage is sealed. Investigators may not enter Secret Shrine.

cards.name: The Crimson Butterfly
cards.text: Aloof. Protected. The Crimson Butterfly's location gets –1 shroud. [action]: Parley. Chase the butterfly. Test [combat] or [agility] (X), where X is your current location's shroud value. As an additional cost to activate this ability, you may spend a clue to reduce this test's difficulty by 1 for each investigator at The Crimson Butterfly's location. If you succeed, move The Crimson Butterfly to a connecting [[Woods]] location. Then, if that location is unrevealed, reveal it.

cards.flavor:
The shambling corpse of this fallen warrior twitches 
and writhes with every agonizing step.
cards.name: Vengeful Echo
cards.text: Patrol (Torii Gate.) Spawn - Hero's Surrender, if able. Otherwise, The Lonely Cairn. Vengeful Echo gets +3 [per_investigator] health. [reaction] After you deal damage to Vengeful Echo: Exhaust it.

cards.name: The House on the Hill
cards.text: Easy / Standard [skull]: –1. If you fail, take 1 horror. [cultist]: –2. If you fail, add a [curse] token to the chaos bag. [tablet]: –2. If you fail, place a clue on your location (from the token pool.) [elder_thing]: –3. If you fail, discard a non-weakness card from your hand.

cards.name: The House on the Hill
cards.text: Hard / Expert [skull]: –X. X is number of the current act. If you fail, take 1 horror. [cultist]: –2. After this test ends, add a [curse] token to the chaos bag. [tablet]: –3. If you fail, place a clue on your location (from the token pool.) [elder_thing]: –4. After this test ends, discard a random non-weakness card from your hand.

cards.flavor: The moon's pale light casts long shadows down the village's narrow alleyways and there is a rustic, time-lost quality to its decor and architecture that unnerves you; at first glance, the village seems deserted, but if the girls have been taken here, you'd better be prepared for anything...
cards.name: Stranger Danger
Out of Time
cards.text:
Something is very, very wrong here. You can't risk any more close calls, so you decide to retreat to the relative safety of the torii gate and regroup, but before you can even begin to flee, you feel an icy pressure tightening around your neck. You claw at the phantom grasp choking the life from you to no avail, and you feel your feet leaving the ground just before the world goes black...
Each surviving investigator is defeated and suffers 1 mental trauma.

cards.flavor: The manor on the hill seemed to be the source of the screams you heard, but you'll need to figure out how to carve a path through the cramped village in order to reach it... Hopefully, before it's too late.
cards.name: A Permanent Curfew
cards.text: Objective - Find a path to the manor. Investigators may spend the requisite number of clues, as group, to advance.

cards.name: Uninvited Guests
cards.text:
You've managed to piece together a map of the village from scraps you've recovered, and it indicates the manor sits at the apex of a grand staircase at the rear of the village. You also found a note---discarded by a guard, perhaps---that explains the steps are imbued with some sort of magical enchantment for extra "security." As a result, there's a particular "trick" to navigating them, in order to deter the uninitiated...
Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. If Endless Ascent is not in play, search the explore deck for it and put it into play, unrevealed. Shuffle the explore deck. Flip Darkened Manor to its revealed side.

cards.flavor: Using the information on the notes you found, you should now be able to make it to the house on the hill if you can get to those stairs...
cards.name: Keeping Up
cards.text: Objective - Enter the manor. If there are no clues on Darkened Manor, immediately advance.

cards.name: Welcome Home
cards.text:
As you place your hand on the door to enter the manor, another shriek rings out from inside, causing the hairs on your neck to stand on end. There's no time to waste and no turning back now; cautiously, you open the door and step inside...
Add all locations with Victory X and no clues to the victory display and remove all other locations in play from the game. Investigators are not defeated by this effect. Discard any enemy or treachery cards at those locations. Put the set-aside Silent Foyer, Moonlit Courtyard, Tatami Room, and Defiled Dojo locations into play unrevealed. Move each investigator to Silent Foyer. Shuffle the encounter discard pile and the 3 set aside Ivory Handmaiden enemies into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: The dim light scatters inside the musty mansion's narrow halls, leaving you feeling more than slightly claustrophobic. The source of the screams you heard earlier must lay further within...but is anybody actually home?
cards.name: The Hardest Homecoming
cards.text: Objective - Search the manor for signs of the missing girls.

cards.name: Crashing the Party
cards.text:
You stealthy slide the blood-soaked screen open and immediately let out an involuntary gasp. In the center of the training room at the rear of the building, the translucent spectre of a woman looms over a young girl. She struggles against the ghostly presence to no avail; phantom limbs keep her pinned to the the floor as long, flowing locks of jet black hair wrap themselves in a stranglehold around the girl's neck. Suddenly, the spirit's head cranes in your direction and you can feel her bloodshot eyes leering at you from behind the curtain of her hair...
Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Put the set-aside Mayu Tachibana (A Missing Twin?) story asset and The Pale Bride (Dearly Beloved) enemy into play at the Defiled Dojo. Check the Campaign Log. If the investigators have been marked by The Pale Bride, place 1 damage on Mayu Tachibana. Otherwise, place 1 damage on The Pale Bride.

cards.flavor: The young girl that the ghostly maiden has in her clutches must be one of the missing twins from Minakami. If you act quickly, you might still be able to save her...
cards.name: The Reception
cards.text: Objective - If The Pale Bride is in the victory display, advance.

cards.name: In Sickness or in Health
cards.text:
After a desperate scramble, you manage to break the spirit's grasp on the girl and the banshee emits one last ear-piercing shriek before dissolving into misty aether. The distant echo of wedding bells disorients you for a moment before your attention returns to the body of the young girl still writhing in pain upon the floor...
(→R2)

cards.flavor:
Despite its apparent restoration, 
the gate now lies dormant.
cards.name: Torii Gate
cards.text: [action]: Deja vu? Search the top 7 cards of your deck for a [[Spirit]] or [[Spell]] card and draw it. Shuffle your deck. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
Are these the really same archways 
you passed through in the forest?
cards.name: Torii Gate

cards.flavor: A cool breeze wafts through the center of the empty village.
cards.name: Village Square
cards.text: [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group: Explore. Put a random location from the explore deck into play unrevealed and then move to it.

cards.flavor: Scattered, flickering lights line the vacant square...
cards.name: Village Square

cards.flavor: A thin layer of fog shrouds the mansion's upper reaches from sight.
cards.name: Darkened Manor
cards.text: Haunted - Place 1 of your clues on Darkened Manor. (Trigger this location's haunted effect whenever you fail a skill test while investigating Darkened Manor.)

cards.flavor: The screams you heard seemed to originate from the mansion on the hill... But how to get there?
cards.name: Darkened Manor
cards.text: Investigators and enemies cannot enter Darkened Manor.

cards.flavor:
What fate befell the soldiers 
who once dwelled within these walls?
cards.name: Derelict Barracks
cards.text: Haunted - Draw the top card of the encounter deck. (Trigger this location's haunted effect whenever you fail a skill test while investigating Derelict Barracks.)

cards.flavor:
Though the structure has been badly damaged, 
the sheer quantity of weapons lying strewn about the wreckage suggests it once quartered warriors.
cards.name: Derelict Barracks

cards.flavor:
Try as you might to scale the steps, 
you never seem to manage to reach the top...
cards.name: Endless Ascent
cards.text: Haunted - Lose 1 resource. (Trigger this location's haunted effect whenever you fail a skill test while investigating Endless Ascent.)

cards.flavor:
The winding stone staircase is so massive 
that you cannot even see what awaits you at its summit.
cards.name: Endless Ascent

cards.flavor: The smell of rotting fish carcasses causes you to wretch. Fortunately, there's no one around to see it.
cards.name: Fisherman's Wharf
cards.text: [action]: Rummage for supplies. Search the top 7 cards of your deck for an [[Item]] or [[Supply]] card and draw it. Shuffle your deck. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
On the bank of a nearby river, the silhouette of 
a wooden structure looming over a decrepit dock 
peeks out through a thin layer of fog.
cards.name: Fisherman's Wharf

cards.flavor:
The blight seeping into the soil 
has spoiled many a harvest here.
cards.name: Twilight Crescent
cards.text: Haunted - Discard a random non-weakness card from your hand. (Trigger this location's haunted effect whenever you fail a skill test while investigating Twilight Crescent.)

cards.flavor:
At the edge of the village, fields of rice paddies 
bask in the scattered remnants of the dying light.
cards.name: Twilight Crescent
Wishing Well
cards.text: Forced - When Wishing Well is revealed: Shuffle the set-aside Downwell encounter set and put it into play face down, attached to Wishing Well, as a separate well deck. [free]: Make a wish. Draw a random card from the attached well deck. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor: "Well, well, well... What do we have here?"
cards.name: Wishing Well

cards.flavor: This ornamental mask was once worn by a royal retainer to conceal his trysts with a low-born attendant.
cards.name: Shishio's Guile
cards.text: Limit 1 [[Headgear]] per investigator. You get +1 [agility]. [action] Exile Shishio's Guile: Parley. Discard a non-[[Elite]] enemy from your threat area.

cards.flavor: The spirits of desecrated corpses wander through the village, mimicking the monotony of everyday routine. Are they real, or merely memories...?
cards.name: Caustic Echo
cards.text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (X), where X is your current location's shroud value. If you fail, you must take 1 damage or place one of your clues on your location. If you fail by 2 or more, do both instead.

cards.name: Fate Falls Short
cards.text: Revelation - Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. Then, if you revealed... - ...a [skull], take 1 damage.- ...a [cultist], take 1 horror.- ...a [tablet], discard a card from your hand.- ...a [elder_thing], lose an action on your next turn.- ...any other non-[elder_sign] token, lose 1 resource.

cards.flavor:
All around you, cured, painted hands 
hang from the walls; whether in celebration or in warning, you can't rightly say.
cards.name: Gruesome Harvest
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (X), where X is your current location's shroud value. If you fail, you must either take 1 horror or move 1 location toward the nearest [[Central]] location. If you fail by 2 or more, do both instead.

cards.flavor:
"There is no calamity greater than lavish desires." 
---Lao Tzu
cards.name: Avarice Mimic
cards.text: Ambush. Revenge -- Draw a card. (After you defeat this enemy, you must immediately resolve its revenge effect, if able.)

cards.flavor:
Many warriors sought comfort from such maidens 
on the eve before a great battle, and the sorrow 
of so many slain lovers weighs heavily 
upon their souls, even in death.
cards.name: Deathbed Companion
cards.text: Hunter 1. X is the number of resources in your resource pool. Forced - After Deathbed Companion attacks you: Lose 1 resource.

cards.flavor:
For some reason, your thoughts turn to 
the shambling corpse of the fallen warrior 
who chased you through the woods...
cards.name: Hitokiri Daimyo
cards.text: Retaliate. Advantage -- Discard the top card of your deck. If it is a weakness, draw it. (Resolve this enemy's advantage effect whenever it becomes engaged with you.)

cards.flavor:
It is said that when a tree has reached a century of life, 
a divine spirit comes to dwell within it. To fell such a tree, 
for any reason, would invite catastrophic misfortune.
cards.name: The Kodama's Vendetta
cards.text: Revelation - Attach The Kodama's Vendetta to the location with the most clues without a copy of The Kodama's Vendetta attached. Limit 1 per location. Increase the difficulty of the first test each investigator performs at the attached location during their turn by 1.

cards.name: The River Delta
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the number of the current agenda.
[cultist]: –1. If you fail, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag.
[tablet]: –3. (–2 instead if you control a ready [[Aspect]] story asset.)
[elder_thing]: –3. If you fail, exhaust The Tyrian Galley.

cards.name: The River Delta
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of the current agenda.
[cultist]: –2. If you fail, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag.
[tablet]: –4. (–3 instead if you control a ready [[Aspect]] story asset.)
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail, exhaust The Tyrian Galley.

cards.flavor: It's a silent night upon the river delta and its calm waters reflect the light of the full moon shinning brightly overhead. You cannot begin to fathom what dangers might lay ahead...
cards.name: Open Waters
cards.text: Each location is connected to each location adjacent to it. Forced - After an investigator moves between [[River]] locations while not attached to The Tyrian Galley: That investigator loses all remaining actions.

cards.name: Sinking Feeling
cards.text:
The river's gentle waters grow increasingly agitated as you navigate them, as if in response to your presence. A chasm opens in the distance, but the glare from the moon is almost blinding now, disorienting you, as if to conceal the churning rapids...
The lead investigator must draw one of the set-aside Hypnotic Whirlpool treachery cards included in the set-aside Watery Woe encounter set. Shuffle the remainder of the set-aside Watery Woe encounter set and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: Your activities on the delta have not gone unnoticed. Wild currents erupt from beneath the placid waters, revealing the churning of restless spirits trapped beneath the surf...
cards.name: Rising Tide
cards.text: All locations are connected to each adjacent location. Forced - After an investigator moves between [[River]] locations while not attached to The Tyrian Galley: That investigator loses all remaining actions.

cards.flavor: It tolls for thee.
cards.name: Shinigami
cards.text: Massive. Hunter 1. Alert. Spawn - Cascade Terminus, if in play. Otherwise, Fisherman's Wharf. Shinigami cannot enter non-[[River]] locations.

cards.flavor: The sound of a bellowing horn rings out over the water. It feels familiar somehow, like a stirred memory. Something's coming... It's calling you home...
cards.name: All Aboard
cards.text: All locations are connected to each adjacent location. Forced - After an investigator moves between [[River]] locations while not attached to The Tyrian Galley: That investigator loses all remaining actions.

cards.name: Without A Paddle
cards.text:
The search for Miyu has turned into a fight for your very survival. You're no nearer to discovering her location than when you started, and the encroaching fog billowing out from the gorge mocks you as it consumes the banks, concealing any possible port from your sight. The sharp pain in your temples intensifies as the ringing of bells grows louder and nearer. The world goes dark...
All surviving investigators are defeated and suffer 1 mental trauma.

cards.flavor: The documents you discovered at the harbor indicate Mayu's sister may have been transported via the river. Miyu's out there, somewhere, and you've got a seaworthy vessel... Time to get to work.
cards.name: Gone Fishing
cards.text: Objective - Investigators may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

cards.name: Still Searching
cards.text:
The settlements along the river seem to be responsible for generating "tributes" for someone or something called "Onigawa." Could this be why the girls were taken? Whatever this Onigawa is, you need to find it, fast. You're running out of places to look, but, as the fog parts, more areas of interest along the delta are revealed...
Put the set-aside Mistveil Strait location into play, unrevealed, to the left of the top leftmost location. For the remainder of the scenario, that location is considered to be adjacent to Mistveil Strait (and vice versa). Put the set-aside Cascade Terminus location into play, unrevealed, to the right of the top rightmost location. For the remainder of the scenario, that location is considered to be adjacent to Cascade Terminus (and vice versa).

cards.flavor: It seems Miyu is en route to something called "Onigawa." There must be some clue as to its location around here; hopefully you can find it before it's too late.
cards.name: Line and Sinker
cards.text: Objective - Investigators at either Mistveil Strait or Cascade Terminus may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

cards.name: In Plain Sight
cards.text: In a moment of desperation, you peer through the viewfinder of the Camera Obscura and attempt to snap a photo. Slowly, the dense fog smothering the gorge begins to disperse, revealing a sprawling sanctum nestled in the cliffs overhead... (→R1)

cards.flavor: The documents you found by the harbor suggests recent shipments have been dispatched from these very docks.
cards.name: Fisherman's Wharf
cards.text: [action]: Running low. Search the top 5 cards of your deck for an [[Item]] or [[Supply]] card and draw it. Shuffle your deck. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor: A lonely ship rocks gently on the water by the rickety pier.
cards.name: Fisherman's Wharf

cards.flavor:
A modest pier flanks a large warehouse 
at the edge of a nearby swamp.
cards.name: Abandoned Dockyard
cards.text: Haunted - Place one of your clues on Abandoned Dockyard. (Trigger this location's haunted effect whenever you fail a skill test while investigating Abandoned Dockyard.)

cards.flavor: The winding river forks into several smaller tributaries, concealing areas of interest all along the delta.
cards.name: Uncharted Wetlands

cards.flavor: Flotsam caught in the undertow batters against the stone cliff beneath the barracks like a battering ram.
cards.name: Coastal Fort
cards.text: Haunted - Discard a random non-weakness card from your hand. (Trigger this location's haunted effect whenever you fail a skill test while investigating Coastal Fort.)

cards.flavor: The winding river forks into several smaller tributaries, concealing areas of interest all along the delta.
cards.name: Uncharted Wetlands

cards.flavor:
The rotting wood of ancient, dilapidated structures 
float in the murky water.
cards.name: Fetid Bog
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues on Fetid Bog: Peer into the water. Test [willpower] or [agility] (3). If you succeed, put the set-aside Sunken Shrine location into play unrevealed, adjacent only to Fetid Bog. (Group limit one success per game.)

cards.flavor: The winding river forks into several smaller tributaries, concealing areas of interest all along the delta.
cards.name: Uncharted Wetlands

cards.flavor:
The architecture of the ominous isle 
suggests military significance...
cards.name: Jagged Atoll
cards.text: Forced - When Jagged Atoll is revealed: Place 1 doom on the current agenda.

cards.flavor: The winding river forks into several smaller tributaries, concealing areas of interest all along the delta.
cards.name: Uncharted Wetlands

cards.flavor: Through a chasm in the ceiling, the cavern is illuminated by soft moonlight, exposing the hideout's secrets.
cards.name: Smuggler's Cove
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues on Smuggler's Cove: A trick of the light. Put the set-aside Sandy Shrine into play, unrevealed, adjacent only to Smuggler's Cove. (Group limit one success per game.)

cards.flavor: The winding river forks into several smaller tributaries, concealing areas of interest all along the delta.
cards.name: Uncharted Wetlands

cards.flavor:
Submerged fragments of collapsed stonework 
obstruct the waterway; the forlorn remnants of 
an archway or bridge from a bygone era.
cards.name: Waterlogged Ruins
cards.text: Clues may not be discovered from Waterlogged Ruins except by investigating.

cards.flavor: The winding river forks into several smaller tributaries, concealing areas of interest all along the delta.
cards.name: Uncharted Wetlands

cards.flavor:
Though the scattered refuse on the nearby banks 
suggest recent activity, passage beyond 
the waterfall's precipice seems impossible.
cards.name: Cascade Terminus
cards.text: Forced - When Cascade Terminus is revealed: Reveal cards from the top of the encounter deck until you reveal an enemy, then draw it. Shuffle any other revealed cards back into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor:
The sound of rushing water intensifies 
as you draw nearer...
cards.name: Cascade Terminus

cards.flavor: Flickering fireflies flank the foggy fjord...
cards.name: Mistveil Strait
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round: If there are no clues on Mistveil Strait, place 1 clue on it (from the token pool.) Enemies at Mistveil Strait get +1 evade.

cards.flavor:
A thick wall of fog guards whatever lies 
beyond the mouth of the winding canyon.
cards.name: Mistveil Strait

cards.flavor: A large stone statue looms over the gate, its shadow cloaking the brigands' dark dealings.
cards.name: Sandy Shrine
cards.text: [free]: Whisper a prayer. Ready an [[Aspect]] asset you control. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
A lonesome gate stands in solitude 
on a sandy shoal at the rear of the cavern.
cards.name: Sandy Shrine

cards.flavor: Freshly left tributes suggest someone or something is still tending this shrine, even after its collapse...
cards.name: Sunken Shrine
cards.text: Forced - When the investigation phase ends: Each investigator at Sunken Shrine takes 1 damage. [free]: What is dead may never die. Ready an [[Aspect]] asset you control. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
A fallen altar to an ancient diety languishes 
in the dark depths beneath the swamp's surface.
cards.name: Sunken Shrine

cards.flavor: "The western wind is blowing fair across the dark Aegean sea..."
cards.name: The Tyrian Galley
cards.text: [free] If it is your turn: Embark. Attach your investigator to The Tyrian Galley or detach them from it. (Limit once per turn.) [action] If The Tyrian Galley is ready: Move The Tyrian Galley to an adjacent [[River]] location. This ability may only be activated by an investigator attached to The Tyrian Galley.

cards.flavor: An unnatural wave rises out of the roiling surf, threatening to wash you away...
cards.name: Sink or Swim
cards.text: Revelation - If The Tyrian Galley is not at your location, Sink or Swim gains surge. Otherwise, test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage, exhaust The Tyrian Galley, and detach all investigators from it.

cards.flavor: She's gone...but she'll never let you go.
cards.name: In the Shadow of the Bride
cards.text: Revelation - Check the Campaign Log. If the investigators rescued Mayu from The Pale Bride, put In the Shadow of the Bride into play in your threat area. Otherwise, In the Shadow of the Bride gains surge. Forced - When you would succeed at a skill test: Discard In the Shadow of the Bride. You automatically fail that test, instead.

cards.flavor: The artifact gives off a gentle warmth that comforts you, but it doesn't seem to be very useful without some sort of film...
cards.name: Camera Obscura
cards.text: You get +1 sanity. [action]: Fiddle with the aperture. Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, each investigator at your location may heal 1 horror. (Limit one success per game.)

cards.name: The War Eternal
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1. If you fail, take 1 damage.
[cultist]: –2. If you fail, you must either add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag or lose an action.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, you must either exhaust an [[Aspect]] story asset you control or take 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail, put the top card of the rally deck into play and resolve its revelation effect.

cards.name: The War Eternal
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: Reveal another token. If you fail, take 1 damage.
[cultist]: –3. After this test ends, you must either add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag or lose an action.
[tablet]: –4. If you control an exhausted [[Aspect]] story asset, this test automatically fails.
[elder_thing]: –4. After this test ends, put the top card of the rally deck into play and resolve its revelation effect.

cards.flavor: There's an electric tension in the air; something ancient and forgotten lingers here, and with every step your foot falls a little heavier...
cards.name: Before the Storm
cards.text: Forced - When this agenda advances: Do not remove doom from the agenda. (Do not advance this agenda until you are instructed.)

cards.name: Into the Eye
cards.text:
As you pass through the gate, a chill races down your spine. A whirlwind of pink petals sweeps across your field of view, temporarily blinding you, and after they pass you find yourself standing in a long courtyard. Beneath your feet, dirty cobblestones form a paved path to its apex, where the massive moon sits perfectly framed within a massive archway. All around you, a sprawling city unfolds, marked with scars telling of a great battle. A war horn sounds and the hollow echo of clashing steel begins to swell all around you...
Put the set-aside Paraselene Plaza, Royal Palace, Desecrated Temple, Standing Stone, Overgrown Sepulcher, Confounding Switchback, Swallowtail Inn, and Spymaster's Perch locations into play, unrevealed. Shuffle the encounter discard pile and the set-aside Siege of Onigawa encounter set into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: Flickering pockets of the ruined city come to life all around you, allowing you to catch glimpses of ghostly defenders being overrun during a great battle that was apparently fought here...
cards.name: Shadows of the Past
cards.text: Forced - At the start of the investigator phase: Shuffle all [[Doctrine]] cards in play back into the rally deck, then put the top card of the rally deck into play and resolve its Revelation effect. (Do not discard this card once it has been resolved; it remains in play until the start of the next investigation phase.)

cards.name: Total War
cards.text:
War is hell. You flinch as a ghostly siege engine crashes through a wall behind you, before immediately turning to dust. You're no military expert but Onigawa's defenders appear to be losing this battle. Badly. How many times has this phantom conflict played out here? Has the result ever changed? Another war horn sounds in the distance; the defenders of Onigawa are rallying for one last push...
The lead investigator must search the encounter deck for each [[Elite]] enemy and draw them. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: The sounds of fighting die down as Onigawa's ghostly defenders make one last desperate attempt to repel the invaders...
cards.name: The Last Stand
cards.text: [[Elite]] enemies in play gain Hunter 1. Forced - At the start of the investigator phase: Shuffle all [[Doctrine]] cards in play back into the rally deck, then put the top card of the rally deck into play and resolve its Revelation effect. (Do not discard this card once it has been resolved; it remains in play until the start of the next investigation phase.)

cards.name: Routed
cards.text:
All around you, skirmishes break out between the foot soldiers of the invading army and the ghostly defenders of Onigawa. A sense of inevitability grips you; this war has raged for longer than you have been alive, and you can't help but lose your nerve as the cacophonous singing of steel draws ever nearer...
Each surviving investigator is defeated.

cards.flavor: The strange fortified city overlooking the gorge is unmistakably conspicuous. The path up the sheer cliff leads to some sort of gatehouse; if Miyu was taken this way, then there must be some way inside...
cards.name: Storming the Gates
cards.text: Objective - Find a way to enter the mysterious city. (Do not advance this act until you are instructed.)

cards.name: Manual Override
cards.text:
With no small amount of effort you manage to sabotage the rotten mechanism keeping the gates barred. You take a deep breath and brace yourself, but just before you push the gates open, a hollow sound somewhere in the distance, like the splashing of water, catches your attention. You strain to listen for it again, but silence is the only reply. It's probably nothing...
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Place the set-aside Ghostly Grudges encounter set into the encounter discard pile. Check the Campaign Log. If the investigators unleashed the Maiden of the Black Water, search the encounter discard pile for the Kayako (Maiden of the Black Water) enemy and put it into play. If it is Agenda 1a, advance the current agenda.

cards.flavor: Navigating through this chaos won't be easy; many parts of the city are completely collapsed or otherwise inaccessible. The caustic sounds of war echo all around you, and Miyu could be anywhere...
cards.name: Intruder Alert
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, investigators may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

cards.name: Unto the Breach
cards.text:
Once again, you've canvased damn near the entire city but failed to pick up Miyu's trail. It appears that members of the court took refuge inside the palace during the siege, but a magical ward sealing the entryway prevents you accessing the interior. Just as you begin to despair, a familiar red glow begins to alight the courtyard...
Put the set-aside Nightingale Antechamber into play, unrevealed. Put the set-aside The Crimson Butterfly (Blinding Beacon) story asset into play at the Royal Palace. If Yuki Yagami is one of the investigators in the campaign, that player must secretly read Scenario Interlude: Sealed Away in the Campaign Guide. If it is Agenda 2a, immediately the advance the agenda.

cards.flavor: The Crimson Butterfly is emitting some kind of energy field that appears to be "stabilizing" the time loop the city is caught in; when the apparitions approach it, they stutter and recoil, as if paralyzed. Perhaps it can help you disable the wards sealing away the palace...
cards.name: A Light in the Darkness
cards.text: Objective - Find a way to enter Nightingale Antechamber. (Do not advance this act until you are instructed.)

cards.name: The Other Side
cards.text:
With The Crimson Butterfly's assistance you are able to sabotage the wards sealing the palace entrance. Apparently exhausted by the effort, the creature falls back to your position and, together, you rush inside and bar the gates behind you, before the ghostly legions it was holding at bay can catch up with you...
(→R1)

cards.flavor: Known as "chochin," such paper lanterns are traditionally lit by loved ones of the recently deceased, in the hopes that such beacons will guide their wandering spirits safely to the afterlife.
cards.name: Dismal Anchorage
cards.text: [action][action]: Memento mori. Heal 1 horror from each investigator at your location. (Group limit one success per game.)

cards.flavor: A flotilla of paper lanterns dances away on the evening breeze.
cards.name: Dismal Anchorage

cards.flavor: The precarious nature of the fortress's approach offers a significant defender's advantage.
cards.name: Treacherous Gradient
cards.text: Forced - After you move to Treacherous Gradient: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage.

cards.flavor:
A winding trail snakes up the side of 
the rock face leading away from the harbor.
cards.name: Treacherous Gradient

cards.flavor: The old gates are held shut by an elaborate mechanism, effectively sealing the city away from the world.
cards.name: Ravaged Gatehouse
cards.text: [action][action]: Manual override. Test [combat] (5). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1 for each clue controlled by an investigator at Ravaged Gatehouse (to a minimum of 1.) If you succeed, advance the act. (Group limit one success per game.)

cards.flavor: A collection of nearby braziers flicker to life as you approach the gatehouse leading into the city.
cards.name: Ravaged Gatehouse

cards.flavor:
A gale of cherry blossoms circles a wilted sapling 
at the far end of the courtyard. A time-lost ancestor 
of the tree you saw in the forest, perhaps?
cards.name: Paraselene Plaza
cards.text: [[Aspect]] story assets controlled by investigators at Paraselene Plaza do not ready during the upkeep phase.

cards.flavor:
The full moon aligns perfectly within the 
massive archway looming over the courtyard, 
as if it was constructed for this very purpose.
cards.name: Paraselene Plaza

cards.flavor: Compared to the rest of the city, the palace appears to have suffered relatively little damage during the siege...
cards.name: Royal Palace
cards.text: Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: Add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag for each clue on Royal Palace.

cards.flavor:
At the center of the city, 
a large fortress stands resolute amidst the chaos.
cards.name: Royal Palace

cards.flavor:
The circuitous highway seems specifically designed 
to confuse and disorient the uninitiated.
cards.name: Confounding Switchback
cards.text: Forced - When an investigator would move from Confounding Switchback to an unrevealed location: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, cancel that movement (still paying any costs).

cards.flavor:
Lanterns alight the twisty corridor leading 
toward the tower in the distance.
cards.name: Confounding Switchback

cards.flavor: This secretive tavern served as a preferred location for clandestine liaisons, whether for business or pleasure.
cards.name: Swallowtail Inn
cards.text: Haunted - Lose 1 resource. (Trigger this location's haunted effect whenever you fail a skill test while investigating Swallowtail Inn.)

cards.flavor:
A quaint inn at the edge of the city 
remains occupied by ghostly patrons.
cards.name: Swallowtail Inn
Spymaster's Perch
cards.text: Non-[[Elite]] enemies at Spymaster's Perch gain ambush.

cards.flavor:
This lavish tower once served as the seat of power 
for the royal spymaster...
cards.name: Spymaster's Perch

cards.flavor: Any relics or sacred icons that were once been housed here have long since been removed by looters.
cards.name: Desecrated Temple
cards.text: Forced - When Desecrated Temple is revealed: Add 1 [per_investigator] [curse] tokens to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor:
The coppery stench of blood lingers in the air 
surrounding this ancient place of worship.
cards.name: Desecrated Temple

cards.flavor:
The pact between the divine pantheon and 
the royal family was sealed via an ancient inscription etched upon this weathered obelisk.
cards.name: Standing Stone
cards.text: [free]: Examine the carvings. Ready an [[Aspect]] asset you control. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
A large, jagged stone behind the temple sits 
surrounded by candles and offerings, 
apparently indicating some sort of religious significance.
cards.name: Standing Stone

cards.flavor:
Enough time has passed since these graves were dug 
that nature has begun to reclaim them.
cards.name: Overgrown Sepulcher
cards.text: Haunted - Draw the top card of the encounter deck. (Trigger this location's haunted effect whenever you fail a skill test while investigating Overgrown Sepulcher.)

cards.flavor:
A field of grave markers protrudes 
from a rise of uneven earth behind the temple.
cards.name: Overgrown Sepulcher

cards.flavor: An arrangement of ritual candles surround a circle of crimson runes carved into the floor, which emits an exaggerated creaking sound no matter gently you step on it...
cards.name: Nightingale Antechamber
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues on Nightingale Antechamber: Advance the act. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
A barrier of crimson runes hanging in the air 
repels your attempts to enter the palace.
cards.name: Nightingale Antechamber
cards.text: The way is sealed. Investigators may not enter Nightingale Antechamber.

cards.flavor:
A translucent, ruby dome surrounds the creature, 
alighting the environment and repelling enemies.
cards.name: The Crimson Butterfly
cards.text: [[Spectral]] enemies at The Crimson Butterfly's location gain aloof and lose hunter. [action][action]: Parley. Weaken the wards. Test [combat] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, you may reveal a connecting [[Forbidden]] location. (Group limit one success per game.)

cards.name: Half Light
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the number of the current agenda.
[cultist]: –2. If you fail, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest [[Elite]] enemy.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail, exhaust an [[Aspect]] asset you control.

cards.name: Half Light
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of the current act.
[cultist]: –3. After this test ends, you must add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag or take 1 horror.
[tablet]: –4. After this test ends, place 1 doom on the nearest [[Elite]] enemy.
[elder_thing]: –5. If you control an exhausted [[Aspect]] asset, this test automatically fails.

cards.flavor: Flickering lights play tricks with the shadows as you navigate the palace's narrow corridors. Apart from the ghostly girl you encountered in the entryway, there are few signs of life inside the palace, but blackened hand prints stick to the walls like ash... Did anyone actually manage to ride out the siege from within these walls?
cards.name: Night Court

cards.flavor: The royal ambassadors were always a real handful.
cards.name: The Offal Extremities
cards.text: Massive. Hunter 1. Spawn - Dim Memorial. The Offal Extremities cannot be defeated. Forced - When any amount of damage would be placed on The Offal Extremities: Remove 1 doom from it instead, or, if there is no doom on The Offal Extremities, exhaust it.

cards.flavor: A hideous, barrelling monstrosity has begun to stalk you through the halls of the palace, and suddenly the mysterious handprints covering every surface start to make a little more sense...
cards.name: Hands Off
cards.text: Forced - When the enemy phase begins: Place 1 doom on The Offal Extremities.

cards.name: Lending a Hand
cards.text:
Despite your best efforts, you seem only able to temporarily delay the creature; each time you manage to hack away at one of its jaundiced limbs, another eagerly emerges from somewhere inside the writhing mass to take its place. Even worse, the acrid stench of smoke and burning wood has begun to linger in every room of the palace...
Shuffle the set-aside Handy Horrors encounter set and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Place 1 doom on each enemy in play.

cards.flavor: You can feel the creature is gaining confidence in its movements; where once it awkwardly fumbled for you in the dark, it now hunts you with a sense of purpose, almost like it has a taste for you...
cards.name: Reaching the Limit
cards.text: The Offal Extremities gains Hunter 2. (Multiple instances of the hunter keyword do not stack; use the highest value for X.) Forced - When the enemy phase begins: Place 1 doom on The Offal Extremities.

cards.name: In Their Grasp
cards.text:
You realize you're no longer even making a token attempt to search for Miyu; your attention is now completely devoted to evading the monsters patrolling the hallways of the palace. You break into a full dash and scramble to find a way out of the palace...
Each unresigned investigator is defeated.

cards.flavor: A curious patchwork of red vines has apparently infested the foundations of the palace and now threatens to impede your investigation. You're not certain if that really was Miyu---you're not even certain if the girl that startled you in the entryway was real---but you've got to take your chances and explore the palace...
cards.name: Seeking an Audience
cards.text: Objective - Search for signs of Miyu. Investigators may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

cards.name: Dead Ends
cards.text:
You keep thinking you catch glimpses of the girl you saw, watching you from the shadows, but whenever you turn to look, shes nowhere to be found. Miyu, if that really was her, seems to have hidden herself quite well... You look down and sigh when you realize you're standing in a pool of fresh blood. As you lift your foot from the mess, you notice the shape of the puddle has a hard edge, as if it's draining through a gap in the floor...
Put the set-aside Concealed Passageway location into play unrevealed.

cards.flavor: You begin to take notice of which floorboards creak and moan as you step on them, and when you stoop down to peer between the slats you can make out something moving below... There's definitely a sublevel underneath the palace; you just need to find a way to access it.
cards.name: Beneath the Nightingale Floor
cards.text: Objective - Explore the passageway under the palace. (Do not advance this act until you are instructed.)

cards.name: Heartless
cards.text:
You hold your breath as you finally work up the courage to pull the sheet back... Fortunately, lying before you is not Miyu's body, as you had feared; it is no one's body at all, actually, only a lifeless mannequin. Whoever designed this automaton went to great lengths to make it resemble a human being, but the illusion is shattered by a deep wound carved into its chest. Where its "heart" would be, there is merely a hollow, bloody chasm. You're about to release your death grip on the sheet and let it fall back over the doll's cold body in frustration, when suddenly a light begins to shine from the vacant wound. A crimson butterfly emerges from somewhere inside the artificial maiden and begins to float up towards the ceiling. You watch its red glow disappear through a gap in the wood work...but the dull pounding on the floor boards overhead snaps you out of your reverie. You swallow a lump in your throat as you come to terms with the situation; Miyu's not here. Maybe she never was. And now you have bigger problems...
Move The Offal Extremities to Undercroft Theatre.

cards.flavor: You hear the cracking of a wooden support beam collapsing in the entryway moments before a thick plume of black, acrid smoke stings your eyess. The palace is collapsing, probably due to the rapidly spreading fire, and now you can't get out the way you came in. You suspect---or maybe just hope---that Miyu was taken deeper into the palace, but every avenue you've explored only seems to lead to a dead end. There must be some other way out of here...
cards.name: Catching Fire
cards.text: Objective - Escape the palace! If all surviving investigators are at Orphan's Gaze, you may advance.

cards.name: The Eyes of a Child
cards.text:
If the investigators have not both retrieved the hanging mannequin and recovered the discarded mannequin:
Despite your best efforts, you cannot discern the purpose of the odd sculpture behind the altar; a hairline fracture, barely noticible, across the meridian of the face taunts you. You notice both its eye sockets are hollow, as if something was meant to be placed there...
Flip this act back over. (You may advance it again later.)
If the investigators have both retrieved the hanging mannequin and recovered the discarded mannequin:
Acting on instinct, you place the mannequins into the sculpture's eyes sockets. As you step back, a clockwork mechanism behind the wall emits a muffled clicking noise...and the child's face slides open, revealing a hidden passageway. You hurry through the opening, barely noticing the sculpture sliding shut behind you...
(→R1)

cards.flavor: The girl is gone, but you swear you keep catching glimpses of her out of the corner of your eye...
cards.name: Entry Hall
cards.text: [action] If there are no enemies in play and all locations in play are revealed: Resign. This can't be real...

cards.flavor:
The entrance is surprisingly cramped; 
it resembles an apartment more than a palace.
cards.name: Entry Hall

cards.flavor:
A candlelit memorial honors the memory 
of former paragons of Onigawa.
cards.name: Dim Memorial
cards.text: Haunted - Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If it is a non-[elder_sign] or [bless] symbol, take 1 horror. (Trigger this location's haunted effect whenever you fail a skill test while investigating Dim Memorial.)

cards.flavor:
Curious trellises of red vines 
seem to have infested the palace interior...
cards.name: Palace Wing

cards.flavor:
The teapot on the table in the small 
reception area is still warm...
cards.name: Chashitsu Annex
cards.text: [action]: Tea ceremony? Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, each investigator at Chashitsu Annex may heal 1 horror. (Group limit one success per game.)

cards.flavor:
Curious trellises of red vines 
seem to have infested the palace interior...
cards.name: Palace Wing

cards.flavor:
Nearly all of the paper talismans on the wall 
are burned beyond legibility...
cards.name: Notice Board
cards.text: [reaction] After you discover the last clue from Notice Board: Draw a card. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
Curious trellises of red vines 
seem to have infested the palace interior...
cards.name: Palace Wing

cards.flavor: The royal servants were confined to a small dormitory on the far side of the palace; out of sight, out of mind.
cards.name: Servant's Scullery
cards.text: Haunted - Discard the top card of your deck. If it is a weakness, draw it. (Trigger this location's haunted effect whenever you fail a skill test while investigating Servant's Scullery.)

cards.flavor:
Curious trellises of red vines 
seem to have infested the palace interior...
cards.name: Palace Wing

cards.flavor:
Two of the handmade dolls in the 
display on the shelf appear to be missing...
cards.name: Mannequin Workshop
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues on Mannequin Workshop: Remember you retrieved the hanging mannequin. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
Curious trellises of red vines 
seem to have infested the palace interior...
cards.name: Palace Wing

cards.flavor:
An overhead lantern sways in an unfelt breeze 
as shadows dance around the edges of the junction...
cards.name: Musty Corridor
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues on Musty Corridor: Remember that you recovered the discarded mannequin. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
Curious trellises of red vines 
seem to have infested the palace interior...
cards.name: Palace Wing

cards.flavor:
The reflected light from the shattered mirror 
hung above the modest shrine disorients you...
cards.name: Meditation Chamber
cards.text: [free]: Whisper a prayer. Ready an [[Aspect]] asset you control. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
Curious trellises of red vines 
seem to have infested the palace interior...
cards.name: Palace Wing

cards.flavor: The impressive collection of tomes and manuscripts housed in the royal library have become infested with rot...
cards.name: Moldering Archive
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues on Moldering Archive: Read Scenario Interlude: The Best Laid Plans in the Campaign Guide. (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
Curious trellises of red vines 
seem to have infested the palace interior...
cards.name: Palace Wing

cards.flavor:
A still beating heart throbs inside a 
small compartment placed upon the altar...
cards.name: Sanguine Altar
cards.text: Forced - When Sanguine Altar is revealed: Place 1 doom on the nearest [[Elite]] enemy. If there are no [[Elite]] enemies in play, flip 1 of the clues on Sanguine Altar to its doom side instead.

cards.flavor:
Curious trellises of red vines 
seem to have infested the palace interior...

The flickering candlelight casts long shadows 
across the cramped bedchamber.

The entity on the stone slab remains perfectly still, 
despite the mass of hands grasping at it...

cards.flavor:
A pool of blood disappears 
beneath the uneven floorboards...

cards.flavor:
A spectral handmaiden shrieks as the monster lurking in her hair begins to feast on rotten sundries...
and anything else within reach.
cards.name: Feast or Famine
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must discard a non-weakness asset from your hand or play area. If you cannot, take 2 damage instead.

cards.flavor: Hungry flames begin leaping from torches and lanterns, racing up into the rafters of the palace...
cards.name: Flame Betide
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, attach Flame Betide to the nearest location without a copy of Flame Betide attached. Limit 1 per location. Forced - When the investigation phase begins: Each enemy and each investigator at the attached location takes 1 damage.

cards.flavor: The shrill chords of a haunting melody grow and diminish in volume as you move from room to room...
cards.name: Secret Chords
cards.text: Revelation - Add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag, if able, and then test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror. Return any [curse] tokens revealed during this test to the chaos bag instead of returning them to the token pool when this test ends.

cards.flavor:
The royal consorts often abstained from meals in order 
to maintain their figure, but the ghastly maw 
now concealed beneath their raven locks does 
not share their "dietary restrictions."
cards.name: Futakuchi Consort
cards.text: Ambush. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: Add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor: Telling ghost stories was forbidden inside the royal palace for fear it would summon the "aoandon," trickster spirits that would snuff out light sources and attack unsuspecting victims in the darkness.
cards.name: Lantern Geist
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter 2. Prey - Highest [intellect]. Lantern Geist loses aloof if there are no clues on its location.

cards.flavor: Reports of various tools and other everyday objects coming to life and "attacking" the commoners were often treated by the court mystics with skepticism...
cards.name: Parasol Mimic
cards.text: Hunter 1. Prey - Least remaining health. Revenge -- Add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag. (After you defeat this enemy, you must immediately resolve its revenge effect, if able.)

cards.flavor: A blood-soaked scroll found in the royal palace of seems to detail many of the region's secrets...if only you could decipher the text.
cards.name: Bloodstained Almanac
cards.text: You get +1 [intellect] while investigating. [free] Exile Bloodstained Almanac: Undo the last action taken by an investigator (return the game state to exactly the way it was before that action was performed, except for the activation of this ability and its costs).

cards.flavor: The strange contraption seems to generate its own phantom film specifically designed to capture images of spirits...
cards.name: Camera Obscura
cards.text: You get +1 [willpower]. [action] If Camera Obscura is ready: Evade. Add your [willpower] to your skill value for this test. If you succeed, you may exhaust Camera Obscura to deal 1 damage to the evaded enemy if it is a [[Spectral]] or [[Yokai]] enemy.

cards.name: The End of August
cards.text: Easy / Standard [skull]: –1. Reveal another token. [cultist]: –2. If you fail, place 1 clue on the nearest [[Witch]] enemy (from the token pool). [tablet]: –3. If you fail, add 1 token to the chaos bag. [elder_thing]: –4. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest [[Serpent]] enemy.

cards.name: The End of August
cards.text: Hard / Expert [skull]: –1. Reveal another token. [cultist]: –3. If you fail, place 1 clue on the nearest [[Witch]] enemy (from the token pool). [tablet]: –4. If you fail, add 1 token to the chaos bag. [elder_thing]: –5. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest [[Serpent]] enemy.

cards.flavor: The air around you grows cold in the shadow of Mount Kokoro. The ground before you is littered with ivory flecks, and the moisture in your foggy breath sticks to your face. Lacking proper equipment, you suspect you won't last long out here...
cards.name: The Sleeping Giant
cards.text: (Reminder: tokens have the modifier "–1, reveal another token." If two tokens are resolved during a single skill test, the test automatically fails and you do not reveal any more tokens for that test.)

cards.name: Slither
cards.text:
As you explore the pass, the path ahead of you winds around a gaping ravine, and when you pass over it, you stop for a moment to glance up through a gap in the fog towards what you imagine must be the summit. Curiously, the snow cover seems to "bulge" around the mountain's peak, and wind around it its circumference in spiral. You wonder what could explain this "natural" oddity, when the moonlight pierces through the thinning fog and reflects off the strange substance, illuminating the faint presence of a hexagonal pattern etched into the ivory surface; it's reminiscent of interlocking plates, you think. Or, perhaps, scales...
Attach the set-aside Orochimaru (Eternal Slumber) enemy to the Hunting Grounds section of the scenario card. It is always considered to be in play for the remainder of the scenario. Shuffle the remainder of the Slumbering Serpents encounter set and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: Apparently, an impossibly large serpent is  using Mount Kokoro as its nesting grounds. The good news is that it seems to be sleeping, for now; there's no way you can hope to defeat it, but if you're careful, and lucky, you might be able to sneak past it...
cards.name: The Ophidian Nightmare
cards.text: (Reminder: tokens have the modifier "–1, reveal another token." If two tokens are resolved during a single skill test, the test automatically fails and you do not reveal any more tokens for that test.)

cards.name: Snakes on a Mountain
cards.text:
The serpent's attacks grow more relentless the nearer you get to the mountain's summit. There must be something there it doesn't want you to see, but you're not sure how long you can keep evading it, and the temperature continues to plummet as your elevation increases...
If Orochimaru (Eternal Slumber) is in play, flip it. Orochimaru (Bane of August) makes an attack of opportunity against each investigator. Flip this agenda back over and place 1 doom on it for each token in the chaos bag. (It may advance multiple times.)

cards.flavor: Ahead of you, a winding path cuts through the snow bank. Numerous foot prints upon the ice suggest recent activity; if Miyu was taken this way... Well, you'd prefer not to think about it, really...
cards.name: Winter Wanderland
cards.text: Objective - Explore the mountain pass. (Do not advance the act until you are instructed.)

cards.name: Hunting Grounds
cards.text:
Your march through the snow grinds to a halt and you decide to stop for a moment to catch your breath. Standing in the middle of a vast open plain, you brace yourself as the blizzard intensifies around you, building to a swelling gale of frost. Your visibility drops to near zero, and you feel suddenly aware of how vulnerable you are out here, alone and unguarded. You blink to clear the precipitation from your eyes, and when they open again, you discover you are standing in the center of a large burgundy circle that looks to have been freshly painted upon the loose snow. The twinkling of distant chimes echoes all around you...
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Add 1 token to the chaos bag. Gather the set-aside Winds of Winter encounter set and spawn the set-aside Yuki-onna (The Lunar Queen) enemy at Kokoro Approach. Then, place 1 clue on Yuki-onna (from the token pool.) Shuffle the remainder of the Winds of Winter encounter set and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: You find yourself entertaining increasingly paranoid thoughts as you draw nearer to the mountain's summit. There's a prescence out there, hiding in the snowblind, you're certain of it. Where did it come from? What does it want? Why is it so cold...?
cards.name: The Dead of Winter
cards.text: Objective - Explore the mountain pass. (Do not advance the act until you are instructed.)

cards.name: The Imprisoned Prince
cards.text:
As you climb out of the depths of the cavern and emerge once again into the light of the moon, the first thing you notice is a craggy expanse of stones littering a small cleft jutting out of the side of the rock face ahead of you. The stones are carved such that the formation resembles the fingers of a giant hand grasping up towards the heavens, and, at the center of the formation, a small shimmering dome crackles with energy. You step forward to take a closer look, and as you draw nearer to the formation, you begin to discern a shape swelling inside of the strange dome; it's some sort of small creature. An animal, perhaps. Though it remains motionless, the creature's body appears ethereal, shifting into and out of existence before your very eyes like a ghostly apparition. Cautiously, you draw ever closer to get a better look at it; you think you can make out its scrawny legs, some feathers, and a beak...
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Add 1 token to the chaos bag. Read Scenario Interlude: The Witness in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor: The air grows thinner, and colder, as you climb higher and higher into the clouds. You're exhausted, but you're close now; you can feel it. Something ancient dwells among the crags of Mount Kokoro...you just need to find it before whatever is out here finds you.
cards.name: The Reason for the Season
cards.text: Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance. (Hint: If the Yuki-onna is not in the victory display when this advances, she may continue to pursue you...)

cards.name: Finding Shelter
cards.text:
If the Yuki-onna (The Lunar Queen) enemy was in play when the act advanced:
Before you enter the citadel, you cautiously take one last look back into the howling blizzard. The witch that was stalking you is still out there somewhere... You can only hope that whatever this place is, she fears to tread it as much as you do...
(→R1)
If the Yuki-onna (The Lunar Queen) enemy was in the victory display when the act advanced:
As you ascend the stairs to the fortress, your thoughts return to the witch that ambushed you earlier. Whatever this place is, she seemed desperate to keep you from reaching it... You can only hope you haven't made a mistake by coming here.
(→R2)

cards.flavor: Utilizing the palace's escape route carried such dishonor than none who did so ever returned.
cards.name: Exodus Pagoda
cards.text: Forced - When the investigation phase ends: Each investigator at Exodus Pagoda must test [willpower] (2). If you fail, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor:
This hidden passage was built for use 
by members of the royal court as a secret 
escape route from the palace in times of crisis.
cards.name: Exodus Pagoda

cards.flavor: A gentle layer of frost coats the stone staircase leading up to the gate that marks the edge of the mountain pass.
cards.name: Kokoro Approach

A treacherous path cuts through the blinding snow,

cards.flavor: The Guardians mercifully granted those who abandoned the palace one last chance to reclaim their honor.

cards.text: [action]: Parley. Cast yourself from the cliffs. All enemies engaged with you are defeated. You are defeated and suffer a physical trauma.

cards.flavor:
A treacherous path cuts through the blinding snow,

to prepare them for a lifetime of service.

cards.flavor:

cards.text: As an additional cost to leave Glacial Arcade: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage. If you resolve a <fro> token during this test, you automatically.

Once carefully tended to by the

now languishes in repose within an icy tomb.

has produced a number of geothermal pools 
perpetually replenished by melted ice flow.

Carved directly into the rock face, intimidating statues 
of Onigawa's former rulers watch over the 
narrow causeway leading to the mountain summit.

cards.flavor:
A treacherous path cuts through the blinding snow,

cards.name: Mountain Pass
