cards.flavor: This ancient fortress was believed by the Stewards of August to be the birthplace of the Guardians.
cards.name: Snowblind Citadel
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues on Snowblind Citadel, spend all of your clues: Resign. You take shelter inside the fortress.

cards.flavor:
A treacherous path cuts through the blinding snow, 
slowly guiding you towards the summit...
cards.name: Mountain Pass
cards.text: As an additional cost to enter Mountain Pass, investigators must spend 1 additional action for each clue on their current location.

cards.flavor:
You shiver as the air grows 
noticeably colder around you...
cards.name: Brain Freeze
cards.text: Revelation - Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If it is a [auto_fail] or token, take 1 horror. Otherwise, you must add 1 token to the chaos bag. If you cannot, add 1 doom to the current agenda instead.

cards.flavor:
Your hands begin to go numb as 
a thin layer of frost coats your fingers...
cards.name: Chilblains
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, put Chilblains into play in your threat area. You cannot trigger [action], [free], or [reaction] abilities on assets you control that take up at least 1 hand slot. [reaction] When your turn ends: Discard Chilblains.

cards.flavor: "Where did everybody go...?"
cards.name: Coldsnap
cards.text: Revelation - Test [combat] or [agility] (3). If you fail, you must either discard an asset from your hand or play area that takes up at least 1 ally slot or add a token to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor: "It'll be fine... Probably."
cards.name: Thin Ice
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Thin Ice to the nearest unrevealed [[Mountain]] location without a copy of Thin Ice attached. Limit 1 per location. Forced - When the investigation phase ends: Each investigator at the attached location must reveal a random chaos token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a token, you must take 2 damage.

cards.flavor: The Jurogumo has been known to play matchmaker, forever in search of suitable suitors for her myriad "daughters"...
cards.name: Jorogumo
cards.text: Hunter 1. Prey - Lowest [agility]. Advantage -- Until the end of the round, as an additional cost to move away from Jorogumo's location, you must spend an additional action.

cards.flavor:
The Konohana Sakuya is said to be a friendly 
tree spirit whose calming presence tames the 
fires in the belly of Mount Kokoro.
cards.name: Konohana Sakuya
cards.text: Aloof. Spawn - Nearest unrevealed location. Forced - When the investigation phase begins: Add 1 token to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor:
Ever since the noble protector of the Mount Kororo succumbed 
to the venom of the Orochimaru, the Rangers of August 
have reported sightings of an ursine silhouette 
shambling through the forests...
cards.name: Onikuma
cards.text: Aloof. Retaliate. Spawn - Nearest unrevealed location. Forced - When the enemy phase begins: Place 1 doom on Onikuma.

cards.name: The Molten Armory
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1. If you fail, discard the top card of the encounter deck until an enemy is revealed and draw it.
[cultist]: –2. If you fail, add 2 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag.
[tablet]: –3 if you control an ready [[Aspect]] asset. Otherwise, –4.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail, place 1 doom on the current agenda.

cards.name: The Molten Armory
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –2. If you fail, discard the top card of the encounter deck until an enemy is revealed and draw it.
[cultist]: –3. After this test ends, add 2 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag.
[tablet]: –4. If you control an exhausted [[Aspect]] asset, this test automatically fails.
[elder_thing]: –4. After this test ends, place 1 doom on the current agenda.

cards.flavor: The soot-laden air makes it difficult for you to breathe inside the volcano, and you loosen your collar as the pools of molten rock belch clouds of humid air onto your face. The temperature alone makes it dangerous for you to remain in this environment for very long...
cards.name: Out of the Frying Pan
Into the Fire
cards.text:
Beads of sweat sting your eyes as you stop to catch your breath. You're not sure how much longer you can keep this up; your supplies are dwindling and the intense heat is simply unbearable...
Each investigator must take 2 total damage and/or horror. Flip this agenda back over. (It may advance multiple times.)

cards.flavor: The "primitive" machinery of the foundry seems to operate autonomously; a complex series of channels manipulates the lava flow towards large smelters and complex webs of gears and chains empty raw ore into carts, which race between smaller furnaces. But to what end? What has been forged here?
cards.name: Hazardous Materials
cards.text: Objective - Survive the hostile environment. Investigators may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

cards.name: Toil and Trouble
cards.text:
The lion's share of the ore and magma seem to either be diverted to channels that service a large blackened anvil that rests on a granite platform near the volcano's zenith, or fueling an impassable flaming portal near the upper caldera. Maybe you can disrupt the mechanisms powering them...or even make the machinery work to your advantage?
Put the set-aside The Firebreak and The Anvil of Creation locations into play, unrevealed. Then, the investigators must decide (choose one):
- Sabotage the foundry: Put the set-aside The Focusing Iris location into play, unrevealed, and remove the current act deck from the game. Put the set-aside act 2a and 3a into play as the new act deck.
- Commandeer the forge. Put the set-aside Molten Crucible location into play, unrevealed, and remove the current act deck from the game. Put the set-aside act 2c and 3c into play as the new act deck.

cards.flavor:
The hot air wafting up from the 
roiling magma below stings your eyes...
cards.name: Ashen Alcove
cards.text: Investigators at Ashen Alcove do not gain resources during the upkeep phase.

cards.flavor:
Noxious fumes rise from the boiling lava 
below the narrow cleft.
cards.name: Ashen Alcove

cards.flavor: Your imagination reels attempting to generate a purpose for a suit of armor of this size, but it seems clear that it was not intended to be worn by any mortal being...
cards.name: Mannequin Behemoth
cards.text: Haunted - Take 1 horror. (Trigger this location's haunted effect whenever you fail a skill test while investigating Mannequin Behemoth.)

cards.flavor:
Surrounded by makeshift scaffolding, 
an enormous suit of ceremonial armor sits in 
repose against the wall of the volcano...
cards.name: Mannequin Behemoth

cards.flavor:
The dragon Guardian, Tsurugi, was known 
to accept offerings of bone...preferably pried 
from the corpses of his enemies.
cards.name: Tsurugi's Roost
cards.text: [free]: Whisper a prayer. Ready an [[Aspect]] asset you control. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
A curious sarcophagus, bound in chains 
and surrounded by bones, ominously observes 
the foundry's activities from a nearby cliff.
cards.name: Tsurugi's Roost

cards.flavor: Waste not, want not.
cards.name: Drainage Sluice
cards.text: Forced - When Drainage Sluice is revealed: Check the Campaign Log. If Mayu is searching for Miyu alone, the lead investigator must read Scenario Interlude: In The Hot Seat in the Campaign Guide. Otherwise, place the set-aside The Tallow Chorus face down on top of the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: The waste byproducts of many of the foundry's activities are all fed to this grisly disposal pit for incineration...
cards.name: Drainage Sluice

cards.flavor:
You don't know enough about lava to know if its 
solid enough to walk on when its cooled...
and you certainly don't intend to find out.
cards.name: Slag Pit
cards.text: As an additional cost to move away from Slag Pit, investigators must spend an additional action.

cards.flavor:
A field of cooling lava forms an 
unsteady archipelago of char and ash.
cards.name: Slag Pit

cards.flavor: The fires of the sacred foundry burned the impurities away from many different "materials"...
cards.name: Pressure Cooker
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must either discard a random non-weakness card from your hand or take 2 damage. If you fail by 3 or more, do both, instead.

cards.flavor: When the foundry smiths' bodies began to fail, their last prescribed duty was to stoke the flame, one final time.
cards.name: In the Hall of the Mountain King
cards.text: Revelation - You must either put In the Hall of the Mountain King into play attached to the current agenda or deal 1 direct horror to each investigator and [[Ally]] asset in play. Each [[Volcanic]] location gets +1 shroud. Forced - When the round ends: Discard In the Hall of the Mountain King.

cards.flavor:
A jet of flame erupts from a nearby lava pool, 
singeing your naked flesh...
cards.name: Scorched
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you must either discard a non-weakness asset from your hand or play area that takes up at least 1 hand slot or take 1 damage for every point you failed by.

cards.flavor: After a civil war once threatened the unity of the pantheon, Kanon decreed that the dissident Guardian Wukong be "reforged" as punishment for inciting the mutiny.
cards.name: Shade of Wukong
cards.text: Hunter 1. Alert. Spawn - Slag Pit.

cards.flavor: When most of Onigawa despaired during the siege, the imprisoned Orochimaru saw only opportunity.
cards.name: Containment Breach
cards.text: Revelation - If there are no enemies in play, Containment Breach gains surge. Otherwise, choose an enemy in play and test [combat] (X), where X is the chosen enemy's fight value. If you fail, place 1 doom on the chosen enemy.

cards.flavor:
Dehydrated due to the intense heat of the volcano, 
you begin to hallucinate sinister shapes emerging 
from within the flickering flames...
cards.name: Heat Wave
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, lose X resources, where X is the number of locations away you are from Ashen Alcove.

cards.flavor:
You can only assume that this charred golem must be 
the remains of one of the foundry's workers...
cards.name: Cinder Manifest
cards.text: Ambush. Revenge -- Place 1 doom on the current agenda.

cards.flavor:
The wanyudo were once the servants of 
the guardian Tsurugi, charged with 
the maintenance of the sacred foundry.
cards.name: Ignition Gear
cards.text: Hunter 2. Revenge -- Lose all remaining actions and end your turn.

cards.flavor: You feel the heat growing more intense as you descend deeper into the bowels of the volcano, and in the distance, the sillouette of a strange orb catches your gaze; perhaps this is the foundry's enchanted power source...?
cards.name: A Hot Mess
cards.text: Objective - Find the foundry's power source. (Do not advance this act until you are instructed.)

cards.name: Out of Focus
cards.text:
The flaming sphere tracks you as you circumnavigate the bowels of the cavern, its blistering gaze eternally unblinking. The heat intensifies as you draw nearer to it and for a moment you feel kinship with the river of tormented souls caught in its gravity well. It stares through you, silently judging you, and then...something inside your chest decompresses, like a rush of air escaping through a pinhole. The lens of the eye cracks, and then shatters like glass, sending its smoldering shards tumbling into the abyss below. The cavern rumbles, nearly throwing you from your precarious perch, and you barely manage to leap back to solid ground before the lava field cools and hardens into a charred glacier of bone and ash... From your vantage, you can barely catch a glimpse of the flaming portal at the apex of the volcano in time to watch its fiery barrier recede...and a dark figure emerge from the shadows beyond. A torrent of spirits seems to circle the grim weapon it carries, and you feel the ground sizzling beneath your feet...
Each investigator must draw a copy of the set-aside Boiling Point treachery and put it into play in their threat area. Put the set-aside Kurama Tengu (The Molochean Hand) into play at The Firebreak. Check the Campaign Log and place X doom on Kurama Tengu, where X is the number of Champions of Onigawa laid to rest. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: The way is clear, but now you find yourself pursued by a mysterious warrior. His blackened armor superficially resembles some of the designs you saw on Onigawa's defenders during the siege on the palace, and yet...
cards.name: A Challenger Approaches
cards.text: Forced - When the enemy phase begins: If no investigator is at Kurama Tengu's location, advance the current agenda. Objective - If all surviving investigators are at The Firebreak and Kurama Tengu is in the victory display, advance.

cards.name: Challenge Accepted
cards.text:
The mysterious interloper shrugs off your blows and launches his own attacks without honor or humanity, but you are able to get the better of him through cunning; you feint and bait a counterattack from him that leaves him off balance near the edge of a cliff, and deliver a follow-up strike that manages to dislodge his footing. Like a shooting star, he plummets through the air and into a pool of lava below. A massive column of fire ejects from where he impacted...followed by a hollow warcry that echoes off the rim of the volcano as spectral motes of light ascend past you, flying towards the crimson moon. Hopefully, that's the last you'll see of him, whoever he might have been...
(→R1)

cards.flavor: Yes, the foundry has fallen into, shall we say, "disrepair," but you can feel the history thrumming through the walls of the volcano; great arms and armor were once forged here, meant for heroes and the champions of gods. Perhaps, with a little help, they might do so again...
cards.name: Fire Drill
cards.text: Objective - Search for the means to reactivate the forge. (Do not advance this act until you are instructed.)

cards.name: Smoke Break
cards.text:
You watch the magma sluice down the crucible's trough, and enter the furnace situated above the blackened anvil below. The molten rock then funnels into a pair of molds above the anvil, which sizzle with the intense heat... While you prepare to let your guard down while the machinery does its work, the lava surrounding the granite platform suddenly begins to boil over, and a massive creature emerges with a bestial bellow, clearly angered by your attempt to "appropriate" its tools...
Each investigator must draw a copy of the set-aside Boiling Point treachery and put it into play in their threat area. Put the set-aside "Sensei" Kanuti (Master of the Forge) into play at The Anvil of Creation. Check the Campaign Log and place X doom on "Sensei" Kanuti, where X is the number of Champions of Onigawa laid to rest. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: Somehow, you get the sense that this massive creature is the master of the forge. Its ceremonial armor resembles an oversized version of some of the mantles you observed on Onigawa's defenders during the siege, and yet...
cards.name: The Master's Tools
cards.text: Forced - When the enemy phase begins: If no investigator is at "Sensei" Kanuti's location, advance the current agenda. Objective - If all surviving investigators are at The Anvil of Creation and "Sensei" Kanuti is in the victory display, advance.

cards.name: Forged in Flame
cards.text:
Eventually, the giant relents, and, with a wounded groan, it slinks away, once again submerging itself beneath the surface of the lava. As if on cue, the molds suspended above the anvil shatter, and when the molten blades come to rest upon the anvil's blackened surface you know what must be done; raising a nearby hammer over your head, you spend a long while furiously pounding the metal into shape, unlocking their potential...
(→R2)

cards.flavor:
Obsidian stairs lead to a flaming portal 
at the tip of a massive stone blade...
cards.name: The Firebreak
cards.text: [action] Spend X clues: Fight. You may use your [intellect] in place of your [combat] for this test. This attack may target an enemy up to X locations away.

cards.flavor: Near the upper rim of the caldera, you can make out the silhouette of a giant sword cleaving the earth...
cards.name: The Firebreak

cards.flavor:
Legends say the souls of the Guardians 
were forged upon this very anvil.
cards.name: The Anvil of Creation
cards.text: [[Aspect]] story assets controlled by investigators at The Anvil of Creation do not ready during the upkeep phase.

cards.flavor: Suspended above the molten front, a mysterious granite platform bears the weight of a blackened anvil...
cards.name: The Anvil of Creation

cards.flavor: The demigod Izanagi sacrificed his eyes to create the sun and moon when his consort, Izanami, became lost to the underworld. Few know that she responded, in kind...
cards.name: The Focusing Iris
cards.text: [action] If it is act 2a and there are no clues on The Focusing Iris, exhaust an [[Aspect]] story asset you control: An eye for an eye. Advance the act.

cards.flavor: It is believed that fire first was brought to this land when the guardian Tsurugi, in need of a flame to temper his blade, plunged his greatsword into the virgin soil and cleaved Mount Kokoro from the countryside...
cards.name: The Focusing Iris

cards.flavor: A series of mechanisms seems to allow you to redirect the lava flow; perhaps you can use it to feed the forge?
cards.name: Molten Crucible
cards.text: [action] If it is act 2c and there are no clues on Molten Crucible, discard 3 cards from your hand: Manual override. Advance the act.

cards.flavor:
A hovering platform near the far wall seems 
to collect runoff from one of the upper lava pools 
and divert it into a series of channels...
cards.name: Molten Crucible

cards.flavor: There's something unsettlingly familiar about one of the faces within the writhing mass of rendered fat...
cards.name: The Tallow Chorus
cards.text: Massive. Hunter 1. Spawn - Drainage Sluice. The Tallow Chorus cannot perform attacks of opportunity.

cards.flavor: Out of the ashes of the conflict that ravaged Onigawa, a new champion emerged. His ruthlessness in combat was matched only by his loyalty to his dark patron.
cards.name: Kurama Tengu
cards.text: Hunter 2. Retaliate. Spawn - The Firebreak. Forced - When the enemy phase begins: Add 1 [per_investigator] [curse] tokens to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor: Kanuti was a friendly giant who inhabited these lands when the Guardians were young. After they rose to power, Tsurugi recognized Kanuti's strength by "honoring" him with a lifetime appointment as his personal forgemaster.
cards.name: "Sensei" Kanuti
cards.text: Massive. Alert. Patrol (The Anvil of Creation) Spawn - The Anvil of Creation.

cards.flavor:
Do not wait to strike until the iron is hot; 
you must make it hot by striking.
cards.name: Boiling Point
cards.text: Forced - When you initiate a skill test during your turn: Increase the difficulty of this test by 1 for each test you have succeeded this turn. Forced - After you fail a skill test during your turn: Ready the nearest [[Elite]] enemy.

cards.name: The Black Harvest
cards.text: Easy / Standard [skull]: –X. X is the number of the current agenda. [cultist]: –2. If you fail, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag. [tablet]: –3. If you fail, search the chaos bag for 1 [bless] token and return it to the token pool. If you cannot, take 1 horror, instead. [elder_thing]: –4. If you fail, perform a Sacrifice.

cards.name: The Black Harvest
cards.text: Hard / Expert [skull]: –X. X is the number of the current act. [cultist]: –3. If you fail, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag. [tablet]: –4. After this test ends, search the chaos bag for 1 [bless] token and return it to the token pool. If you cannot, take 1 horror, instead. [elder_thing]: –4. After this test ends, perform a Sacrifice.

cards.flavor: The strange priest who has abducted Miyu is performing a profane ritual to drain the girl of her essence and summon his dark master to this world. To fuel the ritual and strengthen the magical barrier protecting them, wayward souls are being called to the gallows from all corners of Onigawa, across all time and space...
cards.name: Don't Fear the Reaper
cards.text: Forced - When the mythos phase ends: Perform a Sacrifice.

cards.name: Minutes to Midnight
cards.text:
As more and more souls are sacrificed upon the cathedral's Profane Altar, the Shepherd's body begins to pulse, phasing in and out of existence as the ritual's power intensifies. A spectral silhouette, from some hellish place you cannot begin to fathom, emerges from the aether and gradually begins to take the shepherd's place... You're running out of time. Moloch is close...
Shuffle the Shepherd of the Black Harvest into the sacrifice deck. Place 1 doom on Miyu Tachibana (Lost and Found). Flip the Sundered Cathedral to its revealed side. Put the set-aside Moloch (The Infernal Engine) into play at Profane Altar. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: With every sacrifice that fuels his resurrection, Moloch's intangible essence grows closer to gaining a physical foothold into this world...
cards.name: A Machine for Pigs
cards.text: Forced - When the mythos phase ends: Perform a Sacrifice. Forced - Do not remove doom from any other card in play when this agenda advances.

cards.name: Speak of the Devil
cards.text:
Miyu gasps: the sound of a death rattle. You can feel her slipping away, and, empowered by the senseless slaughter, Moloch's flickering shadow begins to take form...
Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Flip Profane Altar to its revealed side. Flip Moloch (The Infernal Engine) to its reverse side. If Miyu Tachibana (Lost and Found) is at the Profane Altar location, move all doom on her onto Moloch (The Ghost of Onigawa), then shuffle Miyu Tachibana into the sacrifice deck.

cards.flavor: The cataclysm has separated you from both your companions and from Miyu. You need to find some way to regroup...
cards.name: Higher Ground
cards.text: [action] If there are no clues at your location: Flip the Torii Nexus location to its revealed side. (Group limit once per game.) Objective - Investigators at Torii Nexus must spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

cards.name: The Stars Above
cards.text:
You've managed to achieve passage to several of the other floating islands with help from the Torii Gate, but none seem to get you any closer to the cathedral. You turn around and prepare to return to the shelf and come up with a new plan, when you realize that the torii gates on each island have all been perfectly aligned with the rune-marked moon... You pull out the Camera Obscura and attempt to photograph the moon through the torii gate nearest to you. When the shutter clicks, the image in the portal instantly changes to a lifeless, rocky expanse...
Put the set-aside Harvest Moon into play unrevealed.

cards.flavor: It's been there, all along, watching you, and it's helped---or hampered---your investigation every step of the way. Maybe the answers you seek are written in the stars...or maybe you've just finally lost your mind?
cards.name: One Small Step
cards.text: Objective - If there are no clues on the Harvest Moon location, advance.

cards.name: A Giant Leap
cards.text:
Well, you did it: you went to the moon. And, surprisingly, nothing abjectly terrible happened to you as a result. It's surprisingly hot up here, though, and the moon is still high enough in the sky that the thin oxygen levels are starting to give you a migraine. Not for nothing, but, why are you even here...? You manage to bounce around the moon's rocky surface until at last you reach the center of the rune carved into its surface. Inside an enormous crater, a strange object smolders like charcoal...
Put the set-aside Smoldering Spawn (What Was Lost in the Fire) into play at the Harvest Moon location.

cards.flavor: The bloody crescent on the moon's surface appears to be some kind of oval container nestled in the center of a large crater. It's warm to the touch... Perhaps there's some way to open it...?
cards.name: Deep Impact
cards.text: Objective - If there are 4 or more [bless] tokens sealed on Smoldering Spawn, advance.

cards.name: Gods Among Us
cards.text:
You watch the egg-like object siphon away the energy you've worked so hard to generate, like some sort of karmic sinkhole. You're about to abandon hope, when suddenly, it cracks, and a pillar of flame ejects from the surface of moon...
Release all tokens sealed on Smoldering Spawn and remove it from the game. Shuffle all six [[Avatar]] story assets from the Forged in Flames encounter set together, and then check the Campaign Log and proceed to the relevant section below:
If the investigators sabotaged the sacred foundry: Reveal three of the gathered cards at random. The lead investigator must choose one to put into play at Harvest Moon. Remove the unchosen cards and any unrevealed cards from the game.
If the investigators used the Anvil of Creation: Choose one of the gathered cards at random and put it into play at Harvest Moon. Remove the rest of the cards from the game.

cards.flavor: You would not believe it had you not seen it with your own two eyes. The relic upon the moon's surface was no mere anomaly; it was the sacred vessel for a Guardian's rebirth...
cards.name: Evening the Odds
cards.text: Reminder -- Harmony tokens count as both a [bless] and a [curse] token and, during skill tests the performing investigator may choose which of the two to resolve them as. Resolved harmony tokens are returned to the chaos bag after the test ends. Objective - If there are 8 harmony tokens in the chaos bag, or Moloch is in the victory display, advance.

cards.name: What Was Promised
cards.text:
If Moloch (The Ghost of Onigawa) was in the victory display when this advanced:
Moloch howls as he reels from your relentless assault; he clearly did not expect you to be equipped to harm him. His burgundy skin turns to ash as his depraved essence begins to lose purchase on his physical form. The ground below you begins to shudder; in the confusion, you quickly grab Miyu from the altar before hurling yourself into the nearest torii gate...
(→R2)
If there were 8 harmony tokens in the chaos bag when this advanced:
Empowered by your ministrations, the reborn Guardian swoops down upon the cathedral to engage Moloch head on. Crackling bolts of magical energy arc across the landscape as they trade blows, and the impact of their duel hurls you into the portal of a nearby torii gate...
(→R1)

cards.flavor:
Pieces of the cathedral are now scattered across 
an archipelago of tiny floating islands 
that revolve around Mount Kokoro's summit.
cards.name: The Broken Shelf
cards.text: Forced - When the investigation phase begins: If there are fewer than 1 [per_investigator] clues on The Broken Shelf, place one clue on it (from the token pool.)

cards.flavor: The cathedral that once stood before you is gone...
cards.name: The Broken Shelf

cards.flavor:
Once upon a time, it brought you to this place.... 
Maybe, when it's all over, it can send you home.
cards.name: Torii Nexus
cards.text: Torii Nexus is connected to all revealed locations (and vice versa.) [action][action]: A leap of faith. Move to an unrevealed [[Shattered]] location. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
You notice each floating island contains 
its own Torii gate that perfectly aligns with the moon...
cards.name: Torii Nexus

cards.flavor:
Streaming waterfalls pour off the edges 
of these islands, leading to high humidity...
cards.name: Terramorphic Rainforest
cards.text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate Terramorphic Rainforest: Instead of discovering clues, you may add up to X [bless] tokens to the chaos bag, where X is the amount you succeeded by.

cards.flavor:
The thermal energy produced by the cataclysm 
seems to have caused the glaciers on these 
floating chunks of Mount Kokoro to thaw...
cards.name: Terramorphic Rainforest

cards.flavor:
"There was, in their city, a bronze image of Cronus... 
such that each of the children, when placed thereon, 
rolled down and fell into a gaping pit filled with fire..."
---Bibliotheca Historica
cards.name: Worldskein Aperture
cards.text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate Worldskein Aperture: Instead of discovering clues, you may add up to X [curse] tokens to the chaos bag, where X is amount you succeeded by.

cards.flavor:
Onigawa was not the first civilization that 
Moloch has brought to heel; through these 
collapsed and decaying arches, you can catch fleeting glimpses of times and places long since past...
cards.name: Worldskein Aperture

cards.flavor:
The warmth of the foundry below ensures 
the spring's pure waters never freeze over.
cards.name: The Drowning Pool
cards.text: Enemies at The Drowning Pool gain "Revenge -- Remove 1 doom from any enemy in play. (Enemies in the sacrifice display are in play.)" [action] Take 1 damage: Add 1 [bless] token to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor: A punchbowl nested among Mount Kokoro's ice-capped crags features a purifying pond, said to be the very spring the Guardians used to rest their weary spirits.
cards.name: The Drowning Pool

cards.flavor:
At the far end of the shattered ruins, 
the large skull of some ancient creature rests in repose...
cards.name: Sundered Cathedral
cards.text: [action] Discard a non-weakness card from your hand: Add one [bless] or [curse] token to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor:
Floating pillars and toppled spires 
are all that remain of the hidden temple...
cards.name: Sundered Cathedral
cards.text: The way is blocked. Investigators may not enter Sundered Cathedral.

cards.flavor: Was this colossal creature once a Guardian...?
cards.name: Profane Altar
cards.text: [action] Spend X clues: Add up to X total [bless] and/or [curse] tokens to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor:
The skeletal remains of an ancient colossus 
surround an altar of bone...
cards.name: Profane Altar
cards.text: The way is blocked. Investigators may not enter Profane Altar.

cards.flavor: The cloaked figure whispers an ancient hymnal, drawing his congregation towards the altar...
cards.name: Shepherd of the Black Harvest
cards.text: Aloof. Protected. Sacrifice -- Add 1 [per_investigator] [curse] tokens to the chaos bag. Forced - When the mythos phase ends: Place 1 doom on each other [[Elite]] enemy in play (including any in the sacrifice display.)

cards.flavor: You'll get her back... Whatever it takes.
cards.name: Miyu Tachibana
cards.text: Protected. Do not remove doom from Miyu Tachibana when the agenda avances. Forced - When the enemy phase begins: If there is 5 or more doom on Miyu Tachibana and she is not in the sacrifice display, remove all doom from Miyu Tachibana and shuffle her into the sacrifice deck. Sacrifice -- (→R3)

cards.flavor: "We're coming, Miyu! Just hold on!"
cards.name: Mayu Tachibana
cards.text:
[free] Exhaust Mayu Tachibana: Add 1 [bless] or [curse] token to the chaos bag.
[action][action] Exhaust Mayu Tachibana: Choose a card in the sacrifice display and shuffle it back into the sacrifice deck, then draw the top card of the sacrifice deck and add it to the end of the sacrifice display.

cards.flavor: Before the fortress at Onigawa was built and the Covenant with the Guardians was formed, the infant daughters and second sons of peasants were frequently offered up to appease malevolent spirits...
cards.name: Cruel Obeisance
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must choose an enemy in the sacrifice display and remove it from the game (resolving its Sacrifice effect, if able.)

cards.flavor: The rangers were the first line of defense for the Stewards of August. Most met their end during the siege of Onigawa, but rumors circulated that some managed to survive...
cards.name: Molochean Arbiter
cards.text: Alert. Spawn - Torii Nexus. Forced - When the enemy phase begins: If Molochean Arbiter is ready and unengaged, each investigator at its location and each connecting location takes 1 damage.

cards.flavor: He was watching you the entire time, but...
cards.name: Yatagarasu
cards.text: Spawn - The Broken Shelf. Each copy of Murder of Crows has +1 fight, +1 evade, and +1 health. (This effect is active even if Yatagarasu is in the sacrifice display.) Sacrifice -- Search the encounter deck and encounter discard pile for 1 [per_investigator] copies of Murder of Crows and put them into play. Revenge -- Shuffle Yatagarasu into the sacrifice deck instead of discarding it.

cards.flavor: The ancient Carthaginians were so devoted to---or fearful of---Moloch that it is believed they constructed the Topheth ("roasting place") specifically to honor him.
cards.name: The Call of Carthage
cards.text: Revelation - You must either discard an [[Ally]] asset from your hand or play area or place 1 doom on the current agenda.

cards.flavor: Oda Nobunaga was a powerful daimyo whose military prowess was so feared that his contemporaries came to believe he was aided by some sort of malign supernatural force...
cards.name: Nobunaga's Ambition
cards.text: Revelation - Put Nobunaga's Ambition into play in your threat area if there is no copy of it in your threat area. (If there is, discard Nobunaga's Ambition and it gains surge instead.) Forced - After you fail a skill test: Take X total damage and/or horror, where X is the number of [curse] tokens you resolved during that skill test.

cards.flavor:
Many of the innocent souls selected to become 
tributes for Moloch were chosen 
randomly and dispassionately...
cards.name: Macabre Lottery
cards.text: Revelation - One at a time, reveal random tokens from the chaos bag until you reveal a non-[elder_sign] or [auto_fail] token. Then add X [curse] tokens to the chaos bag, where X is the modifier of the revealed token (ignoring +/–).

cards.flavor:
Moloch was known to the Aztecs as "Tialoc" 
and they believed his favor could only earned 
by the cries of children.
cards.name: Tears For Tialoc
cards.text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (4). If you fail, place 1 doom on an [[Elite]] enemy for each point you fail by, divided as evenly as possible among all [[Elite]] enemies in play (including any in the sacrifice display.)

cards.flavor: It is said that crows carry the souls of the departed to the land of the dead. Some also believe that when that soul harbors terrible sorrow, a crow may also bring that soul back to put wrong things right.
cards.name: Murder of Crows
cards.text: Hunter 2. Spawn - Any empty location. Forced - After Murder of Crows attacks you: Discard a non-weakness card from your hand.

cards.flavor: Nothing good can grow here.
cards.name: Bramble Embargo
cards.text: Revelation - Put Bramble Embargo into play in your threat area. You cannot play assets or perform move actions. [action]: Test [combat] (3). You get +1 [combat] skill value for each time this ability has been activated this round. If you succeed, discard Bramble Embargo.

cards.flavor: Their shrines aren't the only things that have fallen.
cards.name: Fallen Pantheon
cards.text: Revelation - You must either lose 2 resources or take 1 damage. If you control an exhausted [[Aspect]] story asset, Fallen Pantheon gains surge.

cards.flavor:
The nauseating stench of rot nourishing the ground 
beneath your feet hangs heavily in the air.
cards.name: Fungal Growth
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Fungal Growth to the nearest location without a copy of Fungal Growth attached. Limit 1 per location. Forced - At the end of the investigation phase: Each investigator at the attached location takes 1 damage.

cards.flavor: Suspended from a tree branch, the cold body of a young child sways gently in the breeze. She is fourteen forever.
cards.name: Mortal Shell
cards.text: Revelation - Discard a random non-weakness asset or event card from your hand. Then, test [willpower] (X), where X is the printed resource cost of the discarded card. If you fail or no card is discarded in this way, you cannot perform move actions until the end of the round.

cards.flavor:
Large, glowing eyes leer at you through the thicket... and you're not sticking around to find out 
to whom they belong.
cards.name: The Woods Have Eyes
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (X), where X is the shroud value of your current location. If you fail, you must take 1 horror and move to a revealed connecting location.

cards.flavor: Something doesn't sound right...
cards.name: Acoustic Dampening
cards.text: Revelation - Put Acoustic Dampening into play in your threat area. Treat assets in your play area that take up an ally slot as though their text boxes were blank (except for traits.) [reaction] At the end of the round: Discard Acoustic Dampening.

cards.flavor: For a moment, you thought you heard wedding bells...
cards.name: The Woman in the Fog
cards.text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Add The Woman in the Fog to your hand and remember that you caught a glimpse of The Pale Bride. You may not mention The Pale Bride for the remainder of this scenario. Each time you do, you must take 1 direct horror.

cards.flavor: A razor's edge separates life and death.
cards.name: Lingering Essence
cards.text:
Aloof. Hunter 1.
Lingering Essence cannot be damaged except by [[Blessed]] or [[Spell]] cards.
While Lingering Essence is ready and unengaged, its location gets +1 shroud.

cards.flavor:
You pull up a bucket...and find nothing inside 
but foul, brackish water.
cards.name: No Such Luck
cards.text: Revelation - The investigators suffer no ill effects. Remove No Such Luck from the game.

cards.flavor: You pull up a bucket...and find a soggy piece of traditional headdress submerged within.
cards.name: A Discarded Mask
cards.text: Revelation - Any one investigator may add the set-aside Shishio's Guile (Guise of the Baleful Retainer) to their deck and immediately put it into play (without paying its resource cost.) This does not count toward their deck limit. Remove A Discarded Mask from the game.

cards.flavor:
Swolen, soggy fingers reach out from 
beneath the surface of the water...
cards.name: The Girl in the Well
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - Read Scenario Interlude: The Maiden of the Black Water in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor:
The mountain in distance---which you believe 
the villagers refer to as "Mount Kokoro"---reflects 
the light of a moon like a warning beacon...
cards.name: Silent Foyer
cards.text: Investigators at Silent Foyer may not put assets into play.

cards.flavor:
An eerie quiet muffles your footsteps 
as you step inside the manor...
cards.name: Silent Foyer

cards.flavor:
A cherry blossom tree watches over 
the small meditation pool.
cards.name: Moonlit Courtyard
cards.text: Investigators at Moonlit Courtyard cannot gain resources.

cards.flavor:
The manor wraps around an open air garden, 
complete with an artificial water feature...
cards.name: Moonlit Courtyard
cards.text: Investigators may not move to Moonlit Courtyard from a location with clues on it.

cards.flavor:
The thin, filthy mats on the floor 
don't look particularly comfortable...
cards.name: Tatami Room
cards.text: Forced - When Tatami Room is revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an Ivory Handmaiden enemy is revealed and spawn it here.

cards.flavor:
A fine layer of dust glazes everything dwelling 
within the manor's sleeping quarters.
cards.name: Tatami Room
cards.text: Investigators may not move to Tatami Room from a location with clues on it.

cards.flavor: The scent of copper and sweat hangs heavily in the air...
cards.name: Defiled Dojo
cards.text: Forced - When Defiled Dojo is revealed: Advance the act. (Group limit once per game.) [action][action] Spend 2 clues: Heal 1 damage from an [[Ally]] asset at Defiled Dojo. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.flavor:
The splash of fresh arterial spray on the door 
suggests the training room was used recently...
cards.name: Defiled Dojo
cards.text: Investigators may not move to Defiled Dojo from a location with clues on it.

cards.flavor:
The young girl writhes in pain on the floor, 
spasming as she clutches at her neck...
cards.name: Mayu Tachibana
cards.text: Forced - When Mayu Tachibana is defeated:(→R1)

cards.flavor: She'll love you to death.
cards.name: The Pale Bride
cards.text: Massive. Patrol (Defiled Dojo.) Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: If The Pale Bride is ready, deal 1 direct damage to each [[Ally]] asset at her location. [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Fight. You may use [intellect] instead of [combat] for this attack.

cards.flavor:
Ivory ash peels from the creature's limbs 
as it moves, revealing charred skin concealed 
beneath the alabaster foundation.
cards.name: Ivory Handmaiden
cards.text: Prey - Least [combat]. While Ivory Handmaiden is ready, its location gets +1 shroud.

cards.flavor:
The moon's intensity hampers your aspect's abilities...
and empowers the restless spirits.
cards.name: Celestial Cascade
cards.text: Revelation - Put Celestial Cascade into play in your threat area. Then, if there are 3 or more copies of Celestial Cascade in your threat area, you are defeated and suffer a mental trauma. Enemies in your threat area get +1 fight and +1 evade. [action] Exhaust an [[Aspect]] story asset you control: Discard all copies of Celestial Cascade from your threat area.

cards.flavor:
You must be imagining things, but 
every time you turn your back, the moon seems 
to hang lower and larger in the sky...
cards.name: Lunar Cry
cards.text: Revelation - Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. If any weaknesses are discarded in this way, draw them.

cards.flavor: You watch a bubble float up from beneath the water's surface and are suddenly overcome with the sensation of drowning...
cards.name: Drowning Sphere
cards.text: Revelation - Put Drowning Sphere into play in your threat area. Forced - When your turn ends: Take 1 damage. [action]: Test [combat] or [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Drowning Sphere. This test's difficulty is reduced by 1 for each time this ability has been activated this round.

cards.flavor: The porcelain skin of the ghostly children gliding through the murky waters all around you shimmers under the pale moonlight...
cards.name: Eternal Blue
cards.text: Revelation - Put Eternal Blue into play in your threat area. Forced - After you fail a skill test: Flip a clue at your location to its doom side. If there are no clues at your location, place 1 clue on your location (from the token pool) instead. [reaction] At the end of your turn: Discard Eternal Blue.

cards.flavor: In the water, there is no escape for anyone who crosses a Kappa. On land, however, it is possible to outwit one; the honorable yokai will feel obliged to return a bow, and so can be tricked into spilling the precious water contained in the dish it carries.
cards.name: Kappa
cards.text: Alert. [action][action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (4). If you succeed, defeat Kappa.

cards.flavor: Many of the bloated bodies found in the water were once fisherman who threw themselves overboard in the hopes of hearing the siren's muted serenade more clearly.
cards.name: Shallow Skimmer
cards.text: Hunter 1. Spawn - Nearest [[River]] location.

cards.flavor:
It is said that the Buwaya carries a chest or 
coffin-like saddle on its back in which it entombs 
the unsuspecting victims it captures.
cards.name: Buwaya
cards.text: Hunter 1. Revenge -- Return an [[Ally]] asset from your discard pile to your hand.

cards.flavor:
Blessed by the goddess with biological immortality, 
the ancient conductors have watched over 
these waters for untold aeons.
cards.name: Primeval Conductor
cards.text: Ambush. Spawn - Nearest [[River]] location. Primeval Conductor cannot enter non-[[River]] locations.

cards.flavor: "There's something down there..."
cards.name: Hypnotic Whirlpool
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Hypnotic Whirlpool to the nearest [[River]] location without a copy of Hypnotic Whirlpool attached. Limit 1 per location. Forced - When the investigation phase ends: Each investigator at the attached location must test [willpower] (4). Each investigator who fails must test [agility] (3). Each investigator who fails this second test must take 1 damage.

cards.flavor: The hairs on your neck stand on end as the nearby water churns as if displaced by an illusory vessel, and the galley is caught in the undertow...
cards.name: Phantom Wake
cards.text: Revelation - If The Tyrian Galley is exhausted, Phantom Wake gains surge. Otherwise, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror and exhaust The Tyrian Galley.

cards.flavor: A young girl floats to the surface of the water, surrounded by a vanguard of beautifully painted fish...
cards.name: The Princess's Retinue
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - Read Scenario Interlude: Damsel In The Deep in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor: The nure-onna are said to imitate distressed mothers crying out for their infants in order to attract "help" from unsuspecting sailors and fishermen.
cards.name: Koi Temptress
cards.text: Hunter 1. Prey - Lowest [agility]. Advantage -- Exhaust The Tyrian Galley if it is at your location.

cards.flavor:
Ghostly reenactments of a pitched battle 
flicker all around you; even in death, 
Onigawa's defenders remain true.
cards.name: No Weapon Shall Prosper
cards.text: Revelation - The lead investigator must discard cards from the top card of the encounter deck until an enemy is revealed and then draw that enemy.

cards.flavor:
Before it was scuttled, the crew of Onigawa's 
flagship, the Shingetsu, ensured that 
the battleship took as many enemy vessels with 
it as possible during its maiden voyage.
cards.name: All Death Is Certain
cards.text: Revelation - Enemies get +1 fight until the end of the round.

cards.flavor: Driven mad by the influence of a dark power, the once honorable Azure Knight of Onigawa employed brutal methods to "bolster" morale and root out suspected traitors during the siege.
cards.name: Death Before Dishonor
cards.text: Revelation - Each investigator with no other investigators at their location draws 1 card. Each other investigator must take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: The wards protecting Onigawa were weakened when the impetuous prince of the divine pantheon was imprisoned upon Mount Kokoro.
cards.name: Serve the Pantheon
cards.text: Revelation - Exhaust each [[Aspect]] story asset controlled by an investigator. [[Aspect]] assets controlled by investigators do not ready during the next upkeep phase.

cards.flavor:
The shattering of Onigawa's covenant with the Guardians was felt by all those who previously 
enjoyed their divine protection.
cards.name: Keep the Covenant
cards.text: Revelation - Each investigator must exhaust an [[Aspect]] story asset they control. Each investigator who cannot must take 1 direct horror instead.

cards.flavor:
When the great cherry blossom tree at the 
center of the city suddenly wilted, this ill omen 
resulted in a critical morale failure among even 
the most loyal of Onigawa's defenders.
cards.name: Take Only What Is Needed
cards.text: Revelation - Each location gets +1 shroud until the end of the round.

cards.flavor:
During the chaos of the siege, rogue elements within 
the city employed increasingly desperate and 
dangerous means to bolster Onigawa's defenses and return their wounded to the frontlines.
cards.name: Honor the Dead
cards.text: Revelation - Until the end of the round, any time a non-[[Elite]] enemy would be discarded, you may shuffle it back into the encounter deck, instead. If you do, you may discover a clue from its location.

cards.flavor: Fearing imminent defeat, the royal guard barricaded the surviving members of the court within the palace during the siege...and fought to the death to ensure no one else would be able to follow them inside.
cards.name: Preserve What Is Priceless
cards.text: Revelation - Move each investigator 1 location towards Royal Palace.

cards.flavor:
When Onigawa's accord with the divine pantheon 
was severed, its Queen made certain sacrifices 
to ensure her people would endure.
cards.name: Death Is Not the End
cards.text: Revelation - Discard all non-[[Elite]] enemies from play, then, for each enemy discarded in this way, place 1 doom on the current agenda.

cards.flavor:
In the final days of the siege, a fallen 
champion of Onigawa was redeemed 
by the selfless sacrifice of its queen consort.
cards.name: Absolve the Crestfallen
cards.text: Revelation - Remove 1 doom from the current agenda. The lead investigator must choose one investigator to lose all of their remaining actions this turn.

cards.flavor: Centuries have passed, but the Maiden of the Black Water still holds onto her grudge...
cards.name: Kayako
cards.text: Hunter 2. Spawn - Dismal Anchorage. Revenge -- Instead of discarding Kayako, remove all damage and doom from her, then exhaust Kayako and move her to Dismal Anchorage.

cards.flavor: She hasn't forgotten...and she hasn't forgiven.
cards.name: Unforgiven
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - If Kayako is in play, place 1 doom on her and heal all damage from her. Otherwise, search the encounter deck for Kayako (Maiden of the Black Water) and draw her. Shuffle the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: The fires of war made quick work of the cramped city.
cards.name: Ashen Purgatory
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Ashen Purgatory to the nearest location without a copy of Ashen Purgatory attached. Limit 1 per location. Enemies at the attached location gain retaliate. [reaction] After an enemy is defeated at the attached location: Discard Ashen Purgatory.

cards.flavor: For many soldiers, the siege of Onigawa never ended.
cards.name: Hollow Legion
cards.text: Massive. Forced - After Hollow Legion enters play: Place 1 doom on it.

cards.flavor:
The invaders' orders were clear: 
no one would be allowed to return home 
until they had captured the palace.
cards.name: Relentless Reaver
cards.text: Advantage -- Discard a non-weakness card from your hand. Revenge -- Heal 1 damage from an investigator at your location.

cards.flavor:
Before the pantheon fell, the Tengu were the sworn 
defenders of the Stewards of August. During the siege, 
they were recalled to the protect the city, 
leaving Mount Kokoro defenseless.
cards.name: Tengu Tactics
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (X), where X is the shroud value of your location. If you fail, put 1 additional card from the top of the rally deck into play at the start of the next investigation phase (and resolve its revelation effect.)

cards.flavor: The Azure Zealot was the first of Onigawa's champions to be seduced by an ancient evil, but he would not be the last.
cards.name: The Azure Zealot
cards.text: Ambush. Spawn - Spymaster's Perch. Forced - When the enemy phase begins: Add 1 [curse] to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor: The Jade Cavalier's summary execution during the siege led many soldiers to question their commanders' methods.
cards.name: The Jade Cavalier
cards.text: Alert. Spawn - Overgrown Sepulcher. Forced - When the enemy phase begins: Add 1 [curse] to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor: The heavens and the earth trembled in equal measure when the guardian Tsurugi forsook his own divinity in order to join the fray.
cards.name: The New Colossus
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - For each location containing at least 1 investigator, you must choose one of the following: - Deal 1 damage to each investigator and enemy at that location. - Flip one clue at that location to its doom side. Then, place The New Colossus in the victory display.

cards.flavor:
In the fires of war, Onigawa's most craven general bargained with a dark power to obtain the strength 
needed to vanquish an entire army.
cards.name: The Scarlet Partisan
cards.text: Spawn - Standing Stone. Forced - When the enemy phase begins: Add 1 [curse] to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor: No matter where you run, they always catch you...
cards.name: Armed and Dangerous
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - Choose an [[Elite]] enemy in play. Move the chosen enemy one location towards your current location and then test [willpower] (X), where X is the chosen enemy's evade value. If you fail, place 1 doom on the chosen enemy.

cards.flavor:
As the appetites of the court grew increasingly depraved, 
so too were the creations the royal dollmaker 
was tasked with constructing...
cards.name: Bondage Mannequin
cards.text: Hunter 1. Spawn - Any empty location. Forced - After Bondage Mannequin moves: Place 1 damage on Bondage Mannequin.

cards.flavor: Once rumors began to spread that the dolls crafted by the royal dollmaker brought good fortune to their recipients, her services became in increasingly high demand...
cards.name: Hinnagami
cards.text: Aloof. Spawn - Sanguine Altar. Forced - When the enemy phase begins: Place 1 doom on any [[Elite]] enemy.

cards.flavor: Lady Bai was once the court's apothecary, well versed in the use and treatment of exotic poisons. When she was betrayed by a treasonous subordinate during the siege, the royal dollmaker offered a way to extend her "life" indefinitely...
cards.name: "Madame" Bai
cards.text: Ambush. Hunter 1. Forced - When the enemy phase begins: Add 1 [curse] to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor:
The torsos of three concubines appear to have been inartfully "stitched" together, giving the monstrous creature 
the resemblance of a centipede...
cards.name: Yatsukahaki
cards.text: Hunter 1. Spawn - Any empty location. Forced - When the enemy phase begins: Add 1 [curse] to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor: The intricate construction of the mannequins you've seen in the palace suggest a practiced hand...
cards.name: Meticulous Handiwork
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - Read Scenario Interlude: The Master's Craft in the Campaign Guide.

cards.flavor:
The serpent's shifting has loosened the earth; you hear the sound of rushing wind mere moments before you 
feel the ground quaking beneath your feet...
cards.name: Avalanche!
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage and, for each point you failed by, move once towards the nearest [[Surface]] location.

cards.flavor: The eternal nemesis of the Guardian Jiraiya, the fearsome Orochimaru slipped into silent repose after his prey "eluded" him once the pantheon fell.
cards.name: Orochimaru
cards.text:
Massive. Protected. Aloof.
Orochimaru has +1 [per_investigator] health and is considered to be at every investigator's location.

cards.flavor: The Stewards of August believed the Orochimaru possesses nine separate heads, though none of their rangers ever lived long enough to actually count of all them.
cards.name: Orochimaru
cards.text: Massive. Alert. Revenge -- Instead of discarding Orochimaru, remove all damage and doom from it and flip it instead. Orochimaru has +1 [per_investigator] health and is considered to be at every investigator's location.

cards.flavor: You feel Mount Kokoro tremble in fear as the alabaster serpent rejoins the hunt. There is nowhere to hide...
cards.name: Waking the Sleeper
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - If Orochimaru (Eternal Slumber) is in play, flip it. Test [agility] (3). If you fail, shuffle Waking the Sleeper back into the encounter deck and Orochimaru (Bane of August) makes an immediate attack against you.

cards.flavor: It's been so long since she had a warm meal...
cards.name: Remorseless Winter
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - If Yuki-onna is in the victory display, put her into play at the Scarlet Omen location, place Remorseless Winter in the victory display, and place 1 clue (from the token pool) on Yuki-onna for each copy of Remorseless Winter in the victory display. Otherwise, place Remorseless Winter in the victory display and take 1 horror.

cards.flavor:
Travelers braving snowstorms in Minakami are often warned of the 
Yuki-onna, who is said to prey on weak-willed men to drain 
their vitality and leave them as frostbitten corpses.
cards.name: Yuki-onna
cards.text: Hunter X. Alert. Forced - When the enemy phase begins: Move a clue from Yuki-onna's location onto Yuki-onna. Revenge -- Move all clues on Yuki-onna onto her location. Yuki-onna gets +X health. X is the number of clues on her.

cards.flavor:
Once twisted by the madness of Moloch's corruption, 
the noble spirit of the Onigawa's "vampyr queen" 
seeks atonement for her past transgressions.
cards.name: Queen Kaoru
cards.text:
You have 1 additional arcane slot. 
[reaction] When an enemy is defeated at your location, exhaust Queen Kaoru : Heal 1 damage from a card you control.

cards.flavor:
Your blood quickens as the translucent orb 
emits a soft, familiar pulse...
cards.name: Icebound Fetish
cards.text:
Permanent. Yuki Yagami deck only. 
You get +1 [willpower] and gain the [[Vampyr]] trait.
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy, exhaust Icebound Fetish: Heal 1 damage from your investigator.

cards.flavor:
The strange light reflected from the 
bloodstained moon disorients you...
cards.name: Lunar Rend
cards.text: Revelation - Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any weaknesses are discarded in this way, draw them. Then, if no weakness is drawn by this effect, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must either take 1 direct horror or exhaust an [[Aspect]] asset you control.

cards.flavor: Tsurugi was said to be the mightiest of all the Guardians; his breath was the fuel that ignited the fire beneath Mount Kokoro.
cards.name: Tsurugi's Might
cards.text: [action] If Tsurugi's Might is ready: Fight. Add your [willpower] to your skill value for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, this attack deals +1 damage. If you would fail this skill test, you may exhaust Tsurugi's Might to automatically succeed instead.

cards.flavor: Midori was the wisest of all Guardians; her skills in diplomacy were critical to the creation of the Covenant with Onigawa.
cards.name: Midori's Cunning
cards.text: [action] If Midori's Cunning is ready: Fight. Add your [agility] to your skill value for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, this attack deals +1 damage. If you would fail this skill test, you may exhaust Midori's Cunning to automatically succeed instead.

cards.flavor:
Separately, the Guardians were unable 
to stand against Moloch...
cards.name: The Pantheon's Contingency
cards.text:
Permanent.
[free] If you control Tsurugi's Might and Midori's Cunning: Exile Tsurugi's Might and Midori's Cunning, then flip The Pantheon's Contingency.

cards.flavor: ...but together, their power would be unstoppable.
cards.name: Kanon's Quill
cards.text: Kanon's Quill cannot leave play. [action] If Kanon's Quill is ready: Fight. Add your highest non-[combat] skill to your skill value for this test. This attack deals +1 [per_investigator] damage. If you fail, you must perform a Sacrifice or exhaust Kanon's Quill.

cards.flavor:
The view is indescribable, but the thin atmosphere 
makes it somewhat difficult to breathe...
cards.name: Harvest Moon
cards.subname: The Dark Side of the Moon
cards.text: Forced - When the investigation phase ends: Each investigator at Harvest Moon takes 1 damage.

cards.flavor:
Bled of its crimson hue, a curious rune described upon 
the lunar surface is now revealed to you...
cards.name: Harvest Moon

cards.flavor:
At the center of the runic confluence, 
a superheated capsule sizzles within a deep crater...
cards.name: Smoldering Spawn
cards.subname: What Was Lost in the Fire
cards.text: [reaction] When a [bless] token would be added to the chaos bag: Seal that token here, instead. Investigators at any location may trigger this reaction.

cards.flavor: Ashes to ashes.
cards.name: Neo Kanon
cards.text:
While resolving chaos tokens during a skill test, investigators may treat [bless] tokens as if they were [elder_sign] tokens.
[action] Search the chaos bag for 1 [bless] token and 1 [curse] token and return them to the token pool: Add 1 harmony token to the chaos bag. Investigators at any location may activate this ability.

cards.flavor: The pantheon's Lord of War always answers the call of battle.
cards.name: Magatsu Tsurugi
cards.text: Forced - When the enemy phase begins: Deal 1 damage to each enemy in play that is not in the sacrifice display. [action] Search the chaos bag for 1 [bless] token and 1 [curse] token and return them to the token pool: Add 1 harmony token to the chaos bag. Investigators at any location may activate this ability.

cards.flavor: Long live the King.
cards.name: Shin Komainu
cards.text:
While in an investigator's hand or committed to a skill test, each non-weakness card gains [wild] [wild].
[action] Search the chaos bag for 1 [bless] token and 1 [curse] token and return them to the token pool: Add 1 harmony token to the chaos bag. Investigators at any location may activate this ability.

cards.flavor: Your chariot of fire awaits.
cards.name: Midori Mirai
cards.text:
Investigators gain an additional action during their turn.
[action] Search the chaos bag for 1 [bless] token and 1 [curse] token and return them to the token pool: Add 1 harmony token to the chaos bag. Investigators at any location may activate this ability.

cards.flavor:
Under the watchful eye of its mother, Mount Kokoro 
has survived aeons of strife...and it will not fall today.
cards.name: Onikuma Kanzen
cards.text:
Investigators may ignore the first attack of opportunity they would take during their turn.
[action] Search the chaos bag for 1 [bless] token and 1 [curse] token and return them to the token pool: Add 1 harmony token to the chaos bag. Investigators at any location may activate this ability.

cards.flavor: No more monkey business.
cards.name: Majin Wukong
cards.text:
When an investigator resolves a [bless] or [curse] token during a skill test, they may return that token to the chaos bag after the test ends.
[action] Search the chaos bag for 1 [bless] token and 1 [curse] token and return them to the token pool: Add 1 harmony token to the chaos bag. Investigators at any location may activate this ability.

cards.flavor:
The power hungry lord of the tides hoped to seize control of the pantheon by offering his dark patron a 
sacrifice borne of his own flesh and blood.
cards.name: The Koi Emperor
cards.text: Hunter 1. Retaliate. Sacrifice -- Add 1 [per_investigator] [curse] tokens to the chaos bag. Revenge -- Shuffle The Koi Emperor into the sacrifice deck.

cards.flavor:
The iridescent scales on the mermaid's limp body 
shimmer beneath the pale moonlight...
cards.name: The Koi Princess
cards.text: Sacrifice -- Each investigator must take 1 direct horror.

cards.flavor: "The Guardians have not given up on us. We must not give up on them."
cards.name: The Koi Princess
cards.text:
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy: Add 1 [bless] token to the chaos bag or search the chaos bag for 1 [curse] token and return it to the token pool. Investigators at any location may trigger this reaction.
[action][action] Exhaust The Koi Princess: Add X [bless] tokens to the chaos bag, where X is the number of revealed locations with no clues on them.

cards.flavor:
Countless millennia of sacrifices power 
the engine of his resurrection.
cards.name: Moloch
cards.text: Aloof. Protected. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: The lead investigator must choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy that is not in the sacrifice display, if able, and discard it. If they do, they must place 1 doom on Moloch.

cards.flavor:
"There are many fates worse than death... 
Allow me to demonstrate."
cards.name: Moloch
cards.text: Massive. Hunter 2. Retaliate. Moloch gets +1 health for each doom on Moloch. Forced - When an investigator is defeated: Search the chaos bag for all [bless] tokens and return them to the token pool.

cards.flavor:
The Scribes of August poured over the ancient apocrypha in their attempts to better understand the nature of 
the threat they faced. Many were not strong 
enough to handle the truth.
cards.name: Betrayers of August
cards.text: Sacrifice -- Place 1 doom on each [[Elite]] enemy in play (including any in the sacrifice display.)

cards.flavor: Many swordsmen who could not protect their liege lords during the siege of Onigawa hoped they could find redemption in the service of a new master.
cards.name: Forsworn Ronin
cards.text: Retaliate. Sacrifice -- Put Forsworn Ronin into play at the location of the investigator with the least remaining health.

cards.flavor: Rather than becoming subject to the tender mercies of the Stewards of August, many prospective shrine maidens preferred to take their fate into their own hands.
cards.name: Defiant Damsel
cards.text: Sacrifice -- Place one clue on each investigator's location (from the token pool.) The lead investigator may choose one other card in the sacrifice display and shuffle it back into the sacrifice deck (and then draw the top card of the sacrifice deck and add it to the end of the sacrifice display).

cards.flavor:
It was not uncommon for members of the court to "donate" their lowborn paramours to the Stewards of August 
once they were finished with them.
cards.name: Defiled Concubine
cards.text: Sacrifice -- Each investigator must take 1 direct horror.

cards.flavor:
The Rangers of August were often tasked with 
recovering wayward shrine maidens who 
became "lost" in the wilderness.
cards.name: Witch of the Wilds
cards.text: Sacrifice -- Each investigator must search the chaos bag for 1 [bless] token and return it to the token pool. If you cannot, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag instead.

cards.name: The Blind Warden
cards.text: Permanent. [free] Before revealing chaos tokens while fighting, exhaust The Blind Warden: If this attack is successful, it deals +1 damage. Forced - At the end of the round: If you dealt damage to an enemy this round, exhaust The Blind Warden.

cards.name: The Divine Messenger
cards.text: Permanent. [free] Before revealing chaos tokens while investigating, exhaust The Divine Messenger: If you succeed, discover an additional clue at your location. Forced - At the end of the round: If you successfully investigated this round, exhaust The Divine Messenger.

cards.name: The Penitent Sentinel
cards.text: Permanent. The Penitent Sentinel can only be assigned damage or horror if it is ready. Forced - After you resolve a non-[elder_sign] or [bless] symbol token during a skill test: Exhaust The Penitent Sentinel.

cards.name: The Sly Bandit
cards.text: Permanent. [reaction] After you evade an enemy, exhaust The Sly Bandit: Gain X resources, where X is the evaded enemy's evade value. Forced - At the start of your turn: You must either pay 1 resource or exhaust The Sly Bandit.

cards.name: The Lonely Monarch
cards.text: Permanent. Forced - At the end of the round: If you did not take your turn first during the investigation phase this round, exhaust The Lonely Monarch. [free] Exhaust The Lonely Monarch: You get +1 [per_investigator] skill value for this test.

cards.name: The Mute Huntress
cards.text: Permanent. [reaction] If The Mute Huntress is ready when your turn begins: You gain an additional action this turn that may only be used to engage or fight an enemy. Forced - At the end of the round: If you dealt damage to an enemy this round, exhaust The Mute Huntress.

cards.name: The Prodigal Apprentice
cards.text: Permanent. Uses (2 charges). If The Prodigal Apprentice is ready, you may spend charges on it to pay the costs of activated abilities printed on assets you control. Forced - At the end of the round: If you failed a skill test this round, exhaust The Prodigal Apprentice.

cards.name: The Restless Widower
cards.text: Permanent. [free] Exhaust The Restless Widower: Move to another investigator's location. Forced - At the end of the round: If you performed a basic move action this round, exhaust The Restless Widower.

cards.flavor: "I made a promise to my sister..."
cards.name: Mayu Tachibana
cards.text:
You have 1 additional hand slot.
[free] Exhaust Mayu Tachibana and add 1 [bless] token to the chaos bag: You get +1 skill value for this test.

cards.flavor:
She was young, innocent, and beautiful...
and now she's gone.
cards.name: Memories of Mayu
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda or take 1 direct damage.

cards.flavor: You couldn't save her. Maybe you can't save anyone.
cards.name: Memories of Miyu
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda or take 1 direct horror.
